text: My wife and i stayed here for 6 days in August .  small boutique hotel with only 12 rooms.  very well designed .  Restaurant food was great with perfect sea views.  The pool was just right.  Staff are friendly and professional . special mention to Made , he was very helpful and genuinely interested in making sure we were looked after. Hotel is close to centre of town and local eateries and shopping.   this was our first time in Candidasa, having been to Bali many times.  We liked the slightly slower pace here and will e back
title: Beautiful Stay

text:
we have just returned to Australia after a wonderful stay at the ALAM ASMARA ' this was our second visit to a great resort ; AGUS organized snorkling equipment for us
 to use as long as we wanted nothing was to much trouble for the staff it is a truly wonderful hotel the restaurant serves great food and a beautiful setting '
  I emailed AGUS this morning to thank him and he told me that the hotel has closed 
and all the staff have no jobs very sad for them ; I am so disappointed  I am hopeful that will reopen at some stage as long as it is not spoiled with some modern rubbish
that will not be in keeping with the way the hotel was good luck to all the staff
title: peaceful setting

text: was here for a week in june, room 12 closest to the pool and restaurant with some ocean views, great staff, special mention to Agus ( not sure of the spelling ) looked after us without being too pushy, sorted us out with a driver when needed ( Newman ), great ocean views from the restaurant, bali dancers a couple of nights, short stroll to the main street of CD with plenty of restaurants, bars ( no clubs ) had a brill day out one day white sandy beach , then the water palace and then to Amed for lunch and hired snorkelling gear from the restaurant for a couple of hours, within 15 metre of the shore it was like being in an aquarium, loads of diff coloured reef fish, great day out. the only downsude is the travel time from the airport , up to 2 hours depending on the traffic and can be longer if there is cultural things happening in the villages on the way but once you are there it's chill out heaven. we had a look around at some more expensive places that front the ocean but felt we had made the right choice with Alam Asmara, will be back for sure.
title: The best chill out hotel we have been in in Bali

text:
This was my second visit to this gorgeous small hotel. I was welcomed back like family.
My only regret is that we didn't stay longer. Candidasa and Alam Asmara are what makes Bali special. Don't bother going anywhere else.(but don't tell anyone!!)
The in house restaurant is great and make sure you do a day fishing and snorkeling with a local fisherman and then lunch in White Sandy Beach. Paradise.
title: Romantic Getaway

text: Why?  Friendliness, diligence and professionalism of the staff, the ocean-front location, consistently very good restaurant, nice and quiet at night and willingness of the management to assist.  They also had on-call drivers who turned out to be more reasonably priced than the local co-op drivers.
title: We'll be back for more for sure!

text:
A really lovely place to stay in Candidasa. Only 12 bungalows
with a pool overlooking the sea. Comfy beds. Good breakfast.
Great coffee which was a lovely surprise. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Wifi excellent. TV in room with good reception .Outdoor bathroom is lovely. Shower pressure not great. Had a scrub and massage in spa and was excellent. Their restaurant rendezvous is also good. A quite and peaceful spot
title: Very comfortable

text:
I stayed two nights at Alam Asmara and I want to go back again to this place. This place is very cozy, has 12 cottages are surrounded by local plants and fish ponds were beautiful and well maintained. The room is clean and pleasant with charming Balinese touches. The staff were friendly and very helpful. 

I really liked the breakfast menu: very fresh, delicious and homemade. It feels very pleasant to enjoy your food right next to the blue sea and the pool. 

This place is highly recommended!
title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

text: My family spent 6 nights at Alam Asmara and enjoyed every minute. Why choose this property over others in Candidasa? Many of the reviews have commented on the beautiful physical design of this property with the greenery, fish ponds and lovely individual bungalows and I agree that the design is gorgeous, peaceful and helps this property stand out. We had two rooms and both locations were private and quiet. In addition, the excellent staff at Alam Asmara make sure that you have a fantastic stay. Because the hotel is small the staff get to know you and provide personalised service. They can organize any tours or activities even at quite short notice and they make great suggestions of things to do. We did the Rendezvous restaurant cooking class and I would highly recommend that as something to do early in your stay. It is lots of fun, the food you make is fantastic and it gives you some understanding of the delicious Balinese food you will be fortunate enough to eat at the restaurant. We also did some day trips including a trip to Amed and the water palaces, and a boat trip to snorkel and go fishing with Ketut, one of the local fisherman. But you must also save some time just to enjoy the view from Alam Asmara and have a swim in the pool and the ocean out the front. Thanks to the management and staff at Alam Asmara for a wonderful stay. We will certainly be back.
title: Beautiful property and standout staff

text: I stayed at Alam Asmara just for one night, which was a shame as I would have liked to have stayed longer. I will definitely return for longer next time. The staff were so friendly and welcoming, I cannot say enough nice things about them! The room was lovely and the grounds of the hotel were so pretty. I am really looking forward to going back again!
title: Great place to stay!

text:
Alam Asmara Dive Resort : what a gorgeous place to stay. We were greeted by the beautiful staff and led down a path, each side water with fish and strategically placed plants to give privacy to the villas.  A small resort with only 12 rooms but how beautiful it is. The room was tastefully decorated and I really appreciated the Insect nets over he beds as I seem to be a bit of a delicacy for all sorts of bugs.  There was no trouble here however.  The outdoor private bathroom was lovely and we both enjoyed it very much. I would love one at home but I don't think it would have same appeal in Winter in Victoria!  The pool was a decent size comparing to other resort pools.  Just lovely for a swim and relax.  The included breakfast at the Rendeavouz Reataurant was quite varied and very nice. You placed an order the night before but no problem if you forgot.  The staff were very helpful and we enjoyed talking to them as many love to practice their English.
I spent a blissful 2 hours at the spa which was very relaxing professional and clean.  
An ideal romantic place for couples, I really loved this place. The highlight of our accommodation while we stayed in Bali.  We will be back for sure.
title: Beautiful, Romantic and Peaceful

text: This is a beautiful resort on the east coast of Bali. We only spent one night here but loved every minute of it. The villas are lovely and surrounded by shallow ponds filled with fish. The food was superb - one of the best eating experiences we have had in Bali - both dinner and the complementary a la carte breakfast. The restaurant overlooks Badung Strait and we were treated to a wonderful 90 minute lightening display over dinner.  Even the rain couldn't distract us from the view. We swam in the ocean in the morning with direct access from the hotel. Staff were helpful and attentive. Highly recommended!
title: A special place to stay!

text: A week spent at Alam Asmara was just what we needed.  Seeking solitude and rest from a hectic work environment, we were looking forward to relaxing.  We felt the stress melt away as soon as we entered the grounds!  Hidden among the lovely foliage,  bungalows appear to be floating on the many fish ponds.  Our room was perfect with a Bali bath - partially open-air, yet private.  The pool afforded a picture-perfect view of the Indian Ocean.  Food was fresh, plentiful and delicious;  homemade sangria was refreshing and beer was cold!  The staff went out of their way to make our stay what we wanted it to be - special food requests, romantic dinner, dive and snorkel trips, local festival participation and spa treatments - We can't say enough positives  about this resort and the service we received!
title: Beautiful and So Relaxing!

text: Excellent design, with an open bathroom. Nice view from the swimming pool. Spa massage ...stone massage recommended.  Breakfast tasty with different choices. You can rent a boat and go for snorkeling at Blue Lagoon and then enjoy the nice view at White Sand Beach. We did it both in the same day. For a boat with 8 persons, we paid 900.000 Rp. Snorkeling in Blue Lagoon was wonderful, nice species of fish and nice corals. Pay attention to the strong current!
title: Very nice design hotel with good restaurant

text: This place was amazing! The property was beautiful and the staff friendly and helpful. The bali breakfast was the best local breakfast at a restaurant I've had so far in bali. The rooms are small, but who hangs out on their room? I actually didn't even notice the size, my friend did. Large bathroom and porch to enjoy a drink on. Only thing I was not as pleased with was the temp of the pool, it was a little warm for me.
title: Heaven

text:
I recently spent 5 magical days at this tranquil oasis.
There are not enough superlatives to describe how lovely this hotel is.
The individual bungalows are small and intimate, nicely furnished, with very good air conditioning.
The staff are fabulous, attentive without being intrusive, happy and sincere.
Lovely huge breakfasts with beautiful views of the neighboring islands.
Dinner is gorgeous at sunset with a Balinese dancer performing twice a week.
I also indulged in a massage one day and returned for a facial which were both lovely and reasonably priced.
It is also a good base to explore East Bali with a driver as its within a few hours of Ubud, and Amed and close to the Water Palace and Traditional Village and White Sand beach.
I also loved feeding the fish in the pond surrounding my room.
Thank you to everyone for a really memorable stay and hope I get the opportunity to return.
If any readers are looking for a driver for day trips or snorkeling trips I highly recommend the driver I have used many times. He lives in Amed so has great local knowledge and is very safe and reliable.
title: "Beautiful and Serene"

text:
Second time we come to Alam Asmara and it is always a pleasure. We appreciate the lovely bungalows, the fishs everywhere, the situation near the sea, very good food and the friendly welcome of the great staff. Thanks to erybody....
Hope to be back soon in Alam Asmara
title: Love to be here

text:
We didn't actually stay at this hotel but called in to have pre dinner drinks.
When we arrived the place was empty which is OK as it is low season. After showing us to a seat and delivering a couple of menus the guy disappeared. After a 10 minute wait my hubby had to go to the bar to order drinks!! Not cool people.The staff were engrossed in playing with orchid plants. We went last year for dinner but I'm afraid I wouldn't return after such terrible service.
title: What the!!

text:
We totally enjoyed our 4 night stay at this hotel.  The room was clean and well-decorated.  Wonderful views from the restaurant and pool with great sunsets.
Staff couldn't be more caring.  Loved the fish ponds which surrounded each private villa.  The spa was so tranquil and the staff were so professional.
The restaurant served great food!
Strongly recommend this property as a peaceful little oasis.
title: Wonderful property

text: A weekend of peace, tranquility and tuning out - what a wonderful place to do it! The bungalows are lovely, comfortable and well equipped.  The staff were polite, friendly, helpful and most importantly happy!  The food was delightful and can highly recommend the Cooking School with Rony.  The view from the restaurant and pool was brilliant, with a fantastic wifi connection how could you not sit there staring off into the ocean whilst catching up on work. My partner and I had a great weekend here and when they found out it was my birthday - well... lot's of getting spoiled.  The onsite spa was lovely as well.  We will be returning!
title: Wonderful Weekend Getaway

text: We used this hotel as a base to climb Mt Agung. The rooms were clean and neat, the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful and the hotel and restaurant was picture perfect.  We also went diving and trekking which the concierge organised for us and we were happy with the price they came up with.  The restaurants in candidasa ranged from cheap and cheerful to upmarket.  It reminded me of the 'old' Bali, and not anything like Kuta Beach is today.  The tourists were older and mostly Europeans.  I would seriously recommend this place and would return in a heartbeat.
title: Sensational

text:
I need to go to Candidasa for a night to do some photos nearby. Where shall I stay? I asked myself. Having been a bit down with a flu, I wanted somewhere comfortable and cosy. Ah Alam Asmara.
AS i checked in, I was a little surprised to discover, that even in February - a quiet month in BAli, they were full except for two rooms. They must be doing something right.
It was just what I wanted. The rather small room was taken up with the big very cosy bed and hanging mosquito net that creates your own cosy world. The TV was close by and a great movie was in full play. I settled down to watch it whiile ordering room service,.
That was the biggest surprise. The prawn sate came with the freshest prawns - I am sure they had just jumped out of the water. The corn fritters disappeared in an instant and I settled back with my pot of tea and the movie. I was there alone, but it would have been equally as nice,if a romantic interest was there too. In the morning, after serious consideration, I decided to enjoy the breakfast by the sea before i headed off to do my work. It was a "morning of the world" tupe of day. The sky was clear blue and a little mist still nestled at the feet of some distant mountains. Everything was perfect. It is really a very nice place to stay.
title: Alam Asmara - the place to chill

text:
What a beautiful little place to stay. Close to everything you need and staff couldn't be more friendly and helpful. Fantastic views when dining.
Close to diving places so the hardest thing you need to do is choose which one to go with. Beautiful rooms and a fab bathroom which is so unique.
I would definitely recommend this spa/diving resort to anybody, me and my husband had an  amazing time and they even made him a birthday cake and an anniversary cake for us :)
Love it Love it.
Thanks guys for a fantastic first time in Bali, you have definitely made us want to come back xx
title: Little Piece of Paradise

text: This is the most beautiful place I've seen. Peaceful and scenic. Snorkelling, diving, trekking, swimming or just laze by the pool. The choice is yours. Then come back to your private room with an outdoor bathroom I can only dream of at home. I will be back!
title: Paradise on the water

text:
What a divine resort,the room was spotless and had everything we needed,the half outdoor bathroom was a lovely experience and great fun,showering while it rained among the orchids, the breakfasts are good and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us being vegans,the food was tasty too.the staff are charming and helpful.
The pool area overlooking the sea with lovely sunsets sipping wine,I felt like Shirley Valentine and my ole man Pedro!! All very romantic   After all the name means place of Love and being both over 70 was pretty good going.  Thank you to all staff. We will be back.from Jane and Dick Bartmann 
Australia 18 th January 2015
title: Heavenly quiet resort

text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here- rooms were very clean, private and quiet. The staff were extremely polite, friendly and helpful. The outside bathroom was great- very clean. Breakfast in the hotel was good- order from a choice. We ate at the restaurant for dinner one night and it was good. View was beautiful, unfortunately no beach but there isn't a beach in Candidasa, anymore.
Would stay again.
title: Lovely staff

text: Alam Asmara is located in a beautiful part of Bali. We stayed over the Christmas holidays with our adult son and his girlfriend. Rooms are very clean, comfortable and quiet. Service was outstanding. Breakfast and meals overlooking gorgeous Bali. Sunsets were amazing. Went on a snorkeling trip right from hotel for about 40.00 for 4--best snorkeling ever just a short 1/2 hour away. My son got to spear fish as well. Very close to other attractions which the hotel can book a driver for you. But the best was the customer service and smiles. A.C. not working in a room--immediately given another room. Need a hairdryer? Of course. Smiles and gracious hospitality. We have traveled all over the world. Very kind, well-priced jewel. Don't let the "dive resort" part of the name scare you. Yes, there is great snorkeling and diving near by. But this is a RESORT.
title: Alam Asmara Paradise

text:
If you go to Candidasa, dont bother to search any other hotels! Stay in Alam Asmara! 

We went to several hotels to check the rooms, and this place is the best place to stay and very comfortable; other places just fell apart and no maintenace plus they charge too much money for the walk in guest.

We stay here for two days and very satisfied with the service, friendly staffs, clean rooms and good maintenance for the AC, etc.
title: The best place to stay in Candidasa!

text: Rooms are cleaned twice daily, and each time the bed is beautifully decorated with flowers. The resort is right on the ocean, the restaurant and pool are overlooking the sea and there are great breakfast options. All in all it is a well priced choice in Candi Dasa with shops and restaurants in easy walking distance. On top of that a birthday was honoured with cake and a free dinner and the staff is very friendly and attentive.
title: Beautiful, well kept boutique resort!

text: This was our first trip to Candidasa and 3 nights at Alam Asmara was definitely not enough for us. The rooms were quite small but lovely and had everything you needed.  The outdoor bathroom was huge.  You could hear the ocean at night as you were falling asleep.  Bliss! The pool was small but again not an issue as there are only 12 rooms in the resort and the most people we came across at the pool was 2.  The staff were genuinely friendly and more than happy to help with tour bookings, directions, etc without being pushy. The manager was visible daily checking that everything was OK and talking to all the guests.  The resort is situated conveniently with massage, laundry, money changer and convenience store all close by.  We plan on coming back for at least a week for some serious relaxing.
title: We will be back!

text: We have again woken after a great nights sleep to the gentle sounds of the ocean.  Only 10 nights into a three week stay here and loving every aspect of this magnificent resort.  Our lovely clean decorated cottage has everything we need with the large semi outdoor bathroom being the highlight.  The staff here are of the highest standard we have ever experienced in our many trips to Bali, friendly, attentive, well spoken, professional with a genuine smile.  The views from the restaurant and pool are breathtaking.  I am looking forward to spending the rest of my stay relaxing, listening to the calming sounds of the ocean whilst enjoying the ambience of Alam Asmara.
title: Waking up in paradise

text: We have stayed here before and again it was a great spot. My wife and I both had a touch of Bali belly and just hanging out in the room or at the pool was very comfortable and relaxing. Hard to beat the view from the restaurant. Nice to have a TV to occupy time with an iffy stomach. It is far enough off the road to be very quiet.
title: A great place to stay in Candi Dasa

text: We enjoyed the clean, beautiful cottages with excellent A/C. Outstanding value for the money. Staff were execeptionally friendly and knew us by name. The only weak spot was the drinks in the hote bar were bitter or served room-temperature (in the case of a daiquiri we had to send back to be blended with ice). The spa is worth a visit.
title: Beautiful cottages and fountains; peace and quiet; good spa

text:
I agree with all the positive reviews. Was here for 2 nights in September before heading further to Gili T. Rooms were lovely, very clean. I was a bit afraid of the outdoor bathroom first but then was surprised that we saw no insects at all. The staff was very nice and attentive. When checking out I forgot my bikini. And we were on the way with a driver they arranged for us.  They immediately called the driver and let him stop and then one employee came running to the car with my bikini. What a service! Unfortunately I was too surprised so forgot to give him a tip.
If you like Candidasa you can't go wrong with this small nice resort.
title: Very nice stay

text: Beautiful small resort, only ten rooms.. Very beautifully designed around interconnected fish ponds. Staff amazing and helpful. Spa was fantastic and inexpensive. Outdoor shower and toilet, loved it,  beach vibe! Breakfast was delicious. Right on the water, so you can just take a dip in the crystal clear water or the gorgeous pool. Will return. Ps:it is not in Balinese culture to immediately remove plates when you are finished eating. In fact,  if you are talking it could be considered rude. So if you want the plates cleared immediately, just ask. The fresh fruit juices are TO DIE FOR.
title: Amazing, serene and romantic

text:
I only stayed here for 1 night before traveling to the Gilis. It was a really lovely stay, the room was beautiful and clean, as was the outdoor bathroom. 

I didn't venture anywhere else in Candidasa and was very impressed with the restaurant food, drinks and service. The restaurant has delightful ocean front views too! 

My only little issue, and it honestly is no ones fault, is that the pool and pool lounges did not get much sun whilst I was there so I didn't get to lay in the sun during my stay. Again, as I said, this is not a criticism just a reality. 

Overall it was a lovely stay, great TV and channels in the room (I was there alone for one night so did use the TV before bed) great big high ceilings with a huge 4 poster bed covered entirely in a mosquito net, and gorgeous staff! I highly recommend this hotel for anyone doing a short stay in Candidasa. Thank you so much for having me Alam Asmara.
title: Really lovely little spot right on the water front.

text:
We stayed at Alam Asmara for 3 nights, and had a very relaxing and enjoyable time there.  The staff was quite attentive, and the hotel is nicely maintained.  It is a small hotel, with only about 10 rooms, so quite an intimate setting.  There is a connected water pond through the whole resort, with koi fish swimming around, which contributes to the nice ambiance.  The sexually inspired bas-relief panels throughout the hotel grounds are quite entertaining as well and add to the romantic inspired setting, although in a somewhat forced way.

Each individual room has its own outdoor bathroom which I found interesting, but my wife was not a big fan; I guess it's not everybody's cup of tea.

We had dinner there one night, and enjoyed some delicious Balinese specialties at the restaurant.  Breakfast was not a buffet style, but you can select from one of the breakfast sets, which were quite decent, although they got a little repetitive after a couple days.  There are lots of options for restaurants within walking or driving distance of the hotel as well.

Overall, a great place to stay if you want to escape from touristy Kuta area, and enjoy a more affordable, relaxing time on Bali's East Coast.
title: Lovely and relaxing resort in Candidasa

text:
We stayed for 7 nights in July after reading such positive reviews on Tripadvisor.  The hotel is beautifully designed with fish ponds between each of the rooms and a small patio at the front of each room, screened by plants to provide privacy.  The rooms are lovely - well maintained, very clean, nice outdoor bathrooms and serviced daily.  The hotel is located at the end of a lane and is very quiet.

The staff are excellent and arranged for us to be picked up from Sanur.  Check-in was easy and from the time we arrived, the reception staff would greet us by name.  The morning after we arrived, a staff member asked us if we were happy with our room.  He mentioned that another couple had commented that the reading lights were a bit dim and could be a little brighter.  My husband agreed.  By the time we got back to our room after breakfast, we had new light bulbs. 

There are many restaurants close by including Vincent's which has live jazz every Thursday night.  We ate a couple of times at the warung at the top of the lane as well as Warung Boni which is a small restaurant with only 4 tables (see Tripadvisor reviews).  The hotel restaurant is also good. There is a small supermarket across the road along with a money-changer and a larger supermarket about a 10 minute walk away.  The ATM is opposite the larger supermarket. There is a local doctor and a pharmacy.

You can snorkel straight from the hotel steps near the restaurant - the water is very clean and crystal clear and there are plenty of small fish to see.  The local fishermen offer snorkeling trips to Blue Lagoon or white sand beach for around 400,000 rupiah or you can book with reception.  We didn't take this up, as we were moving on to Amed after our stay (Amed has excellent snorkeling and diving).  Having looked at some of the other hotels while we were in Candi Dasa, we would say that Alam Asmara has one of the nicest swimming spots right out front.

Breakfast is very good and plentiful, with a range of options which they like you to book the night before.

There is free wi-fi in the rooms and the restaurant (can be a bit weak inside the room at times, but no trouble from the restaurant).

We really can't think of any areas for improvement with this hotel.  It has a really lovely feel to it.  The staff are friendly and professional, the location is great, the outlook is beautiful, everything is very clean and well maintained. 

We really enjoyed our week in Candi Dasa and we highly recommend Alam Asmara.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

photos.caption: A new towel design, every day

text: Our recent stay at Alam Asmara was fantastic.  We have arranged to have a commitment ceremony during at the hotel and the staff were super helpful.  The ceremony was wonderful and the staff had made trails of flowers to our room and throughout our room...it was beautiful and very romantic.  The outdoor bathroom is also lovely.  The hotel itself is over water with fish in ponds around the rooms, it is really lovely.  The breakfast is good. The spa and massage are also very good and well priced. Vincents restaurant is across the road and has Jazz on a Thursday night.
title: Great staff and lovely resort

text: Great helpful staff with exceptional personalized service. The resort has great decor, private and surrounded by many restaurants. Definitely a great place to stay. If you are a diver, you would definitely appreciate the dive planning, organization and logistics - they have thought of everything from a takeaway meals to equipment cleaning area in the resort.
title: Exceptional and personalized service

text: We stayed here for only one day but we will certainly come back. The hotel has a very nice layout, the kitchen of the adjoining restaurant is very good but the real asset of the resort is the very friendly staff. We highly recommend this resort!
title: Nice resort with excellent staff

text: Just spent 5 nights here with my wife, from the moment we arrived I loved it. The rooms are very clean and the walkways with rivers of coy carp swimming below are cool. The staff remember your name and greet you. All in all a beautiful place to visit.
title: Beautiful place to be

text:
We stayed at Alam Asmara for 3 nights but wish it had been more. The resort only has 12 rooms so is very peaceful. Very well thought out design with a lovely central path surrounded by koi ponds leading down to the pool and restaurant which both overlook the sea. The staff went above and beyond to ensure we had the perfect stay. The beds were very comfortable and the view over the water in the evening made it tempting not to ever leave the resort.
Couldn't recommend it more highly!
title: Wonderful spot for complete relaxation

text: This relatively small magnificent resort in Candidasa has everything you wish for. The villas are very comfy, with a good bed and a nicely outside bathroom. Alongside the villas there are koi´s all over swimming and all is situated in a tropical garden. At the oceanside there is the beatifull swimming pool and the restaurant with nice views on the oceasn and the nearby islands. The breakfast, included in the price !, is very good, you can choose all kinds and view from the restaurant is fantastic. You van gave a good dinner here, but one of the best restaurants of Candidasa is just across teh street (see my other review). The staff is also very friendly and everything is very clean. We highly recommend Alam Asmara for your stay in Candidasa.
title: Gorguous small resort

text: After arriving on a early morning flight we were promptly picked up from the airport by resort staff. Agus was exceptionally friendly and helpful during our stay and nothing was ever too much trouble with any of the staff. Our room was ready even though we were early, it was clean and what a surprise to walk the boardwalk to our room with all the running water and foliage you wouldn't know anyone else was at the resort. The food was great freshly cooked and plenty of variety. We did a days dive with YOS dive and had a fantastic day with them. Wish we stayed longer at Alam Asmara rather than Kuta was soooo quiet and relaxing. Would have liked to have known Alam Asmara support an orphanage as I would have taken clothing and school supplies for them in my half empty suitcase. We certainly will be repeat guests to Alam Asmara when we return for another holiday.
title: Thank goodness I chose Alam Asmara

text: Entry of the resort wouldn't give you much expectation but once you step into the door, it clear my mind. It's a tiny resort but variety of plants, ponds of fishes, greenery pave way refresh my soul. Ideal for couples to spend few days here. Rooms are comparatively small, bathroom at back provide sufficient sunlight and space sharing half of the chalet. Small balcony in front is leisure for smoking and reading. Very good attendants gave us all their smiles and help. Food provided need improvement. YOS Bali dive center provide all our needs for diving. It was a present stay for us.
title: An elegant decorated dive resort for couples

owner_response.text:
We  thank you for your attention and have provided input to our resort, you may  experience can be accepted by other tourists.

we would love if you can stay back at Alam Asmara.

on behalf of the management and staff would like to thank and we gladly await your return.


I Wayan Kariasa
General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

photos.caption: Attendants take care of all details

text:
The entrance to Alam Asmara is hidden from the street with poor signage & looks like any other mediocre little resort when you arrive at it's entrance. But we thought we had died & gone to heaven when we walked down a draping tree flanked path, gold fish swimming either side, toward the ocean view & our Balinese villa. This place is gorgeous! We were luck y enough to be guests at a Balinese wedding in a near-by village & the staff went to all sorts of trouble to dress us appropriately & prepare us for a Hindu wedding. One of the staff members, Agus, was so helpful telling us about the history, religious & cultural practices & even loaned my partner head-gear & sarongs teaching us the way to tie them - differently for men & women. 
We had a morning sailing from the peer in front of the hotel & went snorkelling discovering the most spectacular display of fish either of us had ever seen.   
The food was great, especially the lobster as a special treat - we shared one for a late dinner - splurging the grand total of $17. For a change in Bali the wine was ok & not expensive. I will definitely return to Alam Asmara - soon!!
title: The Best Bali Has To Offer

photos.caption: Off to see some beautiful underwater life

text: Thanks Agus for making our stay at your hotel the best, you run a very tight ship and your staff were very attentive to our every need my family said your hotel was the highlight of our 17 day trip to Bali as we stayed in 3 other hotels as well. We hope to come back soon. Steve Bunbury West Australia
title: best hotel be back

text:
My husband and I stayed at this resort last month for 2 nights.  We weren't sure what to expect, however, we were blown away by everything Alam Asmara had to offer.  The service was excellent - especially from the wait staff, and the food was some of the best I have ever eaten in Bali.  All our meals were fresh and served with great presentation.  I loved the complimentary garlic bread we got with each meal.  The restaurant is a perfect setting for romantic dinners at night and during the day you can't beat the view of the ocean. 
Our room was lovely.  To start with everything was very clean.  Often I fear that Balinese hotels wipe things over rather than clean them properly with products  and the floors never look clean but I didn't feel that was so at Alam Asmara.  We loved the outdoor bathroom and the beds were extremely comfortable.  We loved the fish ponds surrounding each bungalow and the gardens gave a real sense of privacy.  The only thing I could recommend is putting DVD players  and a kettle in the room. 
I have recommended this hotel to everyone I know and I will definitely go back.
title: Bliss!

text:
I think AADR are possibly doing themselves a disservice by billing themselves as a dive resort.  I didn't come here as a diver but rather as a part of my honeymoon.  I dive quite a lot though and the dive part of this property is it's weak link. I was 'allowed' to sneak a dive in though and  I spoke to the Hotel's street presence and after doing so I decided to use a different operator.

The hotel facilities were great - clean and fairly well appointed.  The property is accessed by traveling about 50m down a lane from the main road.  If the lane was beautified a bit it would aid the property greatly as once inside, it is lovely.   The gardens are lovely and a series of boardwalks covers the fish pond that runs the length down to the pool and then the ocean. 

The staff were outstanding.  They take improvement seriously and have an active programme to improve every day. This show in the local staff training programme.  If only I could bottle this and take it home to Perth.

I'd happily stay here again.
title: Lovely

text: I booked this after checking many websites re accommodation in Candi Dasa.  The resort is down a small laneway.  Once inside the resort the walk to our room was amazing.  Raised paving stones over a fish pond that ran the length of the resort and betweeen each of the rooms.  The room was beautiful.  The large bed was surrounded by a mosquito net.  Loved the outdoor bathroom.  It was also great to be able to sit out on our 'verandah' and have a drink or two before heading out for dinner.  Slept like a baby as I could hear the sea lapping at the edge of the resort wall. As it was only a small resort it was very quiet.  The only downside was that I had booked the first two nights on a internet booking site and when I wanted to extend for a further night the resort would not match the previous price I had paid.  We ended up staying at another place down the road that was pretty disgusting - but at a similar price that I had previously paid.  All my own fault for not prebooking the third night.
title: Charming rooms.

text:
My bf and I stayed at Alam Asmara for 3 nights after transferring from Alam Kulkul Kuta, we simply love it there in Candidasa, especially the Rendezvous restaurant which serves great food with tentative services.

The view from the restaurant is spectacular, it's kinda small but we got we needed.  

Our room is very clean, and we could use the outdoor shower forever!  The surrounding is very cosy.

Service from Alam Asmara leaves a very good impressive, they remember where we sit and reserve the seats for us on our final night.
title: Simply love it

text: This small resort was the perfect start for a relaxing holiday in Bali. Our adult daughters were with us and we loved the atmosphere of Alam Asmara. Breakfast in the ocean front restaurant was a wonderful start to the day and the service throughout our stay was excellent. We also liked being able to walk down the steps from the rsort and swim in the ocean then come back to the pool for another dip. Didn't bother us that there wasn't any beach front. During our 3 day visit we had meals at lovely  local restaurants and fitted in a day trip to Amed for some snorkeling. A great place if you want to be away from the crowds and are after a relaxed break.
title: Glorious few days

text:
I stayed at Alam Asmara for two nights in October because I wanted to be in close proximity to Padang Bai's fast boats to Gili Island. The hotel itself is quite nice with beautiful rooms and comfortable outdoor washrooms. I would have loved to stay here with my boyfriend, but given that I was travelling alone this time, this resort felt a little awkward. It's quite charming and would be ideal for couples. I ate in the restaurant once but then ventured out into the town and found great little places to eat. The hotel also has fairly reliable wifi in the rooms, which I really liked.

BEWARE: I could have perhaps just been blind, but from what I gather there are no ATMs in Candidasa, so make sure you have ample cash when you get there. Also, there really is NO beach in Candidasa and minimal shopping so if you're coming, ensure it is purely for a quiet vacation. My two nights were plenty for me.

TRY: I rented a guide who owned a scooter and headed up the coast one afternoon to Amed to see traditional sea salt processing. He was a FANTASTIC guide and stopped at tons of places for me to take pictures and knew a great deal about each place we stopped. I think I paid around 150 000 rupiahs for the 4-5 hours I was with him.
title: Nice hotel, but maybe not the best for a solo traveller

text: A true gem in the wonderful town of Candidasa. Only 12 bungalows and a great restaurant, so a wonderfully personalised service. Couldn't think of a more relaxed and friendly place to stay. Go and see - you won't be disappointed!
title: An absolutely perfect hideaway

text:
We originally booked Alam Asmara for 5 nights, but ended up staying for 4 (not as a result of anything wrong with the hotel though!).

The hotel is lovely, there are 12 individual bungalows which basically look like the photos except there is a huge, lovely mosquito net over the bed, making it look more like a 4 poster. There isn’t much storage in the room, but it was adequate for our needs.

There is a mini bar but the cost was expensive – 12,000RP for a small bottle of water compared with 2,500RP in the shops. There is a safe in the room.

The bathroom is open air but there weren’t too many bugs – we had a couple of resident geckos to help keep them down. Ladies, there is a hairdryer provided but it isn’t very powerful and your hair will probably dry quicker naturally!

There aren’t many beds around the pool but it was never busy, in fact on most occasions we were the only ones there.

Breakfast was ok, the menu changed daily with a couple of choices and there was a small buffet selection, it wasn’t awesome but it did the trick.

Candidasa is very low key, not much going on at all which is why we decided to leave after 4 nights. If you are diving then there will probably be plenty to keep you occupied, but after doing the trips we wanted there was little for us to do. There is no beach at all (although we were expecting this), the coral is trying to come back in the lagoon and there are some small nice patches.

It is ideally located for access to Tirta Gangga (which we didn’t think was that impressive), Tengennan, and the Amed coast is about 1 hour away. We did a fantastic half day trek through the rice fields with Made who works behind the bar in Friends bar – highly recommended!

Overall, a really nice hotel, recommended for a stay in Candidasa.
title: Nice hotel

text:
Stayed September 19-21, 2010.

This is a beautiful hotel.  The rooms are clean, and well appointed.  The bathrooms were as well.  The pictures that others have posted are dead on.  This place really looks like that.  There is no real beach to speak of, but I knew that going in, and so that wasn't an issue for me.  There are beaches nearby though.  Though their pool is so nice I'm not sure you'd ever need to bother with the beach.  The staff was very friendly and very attentive.  The staff in the restaurant was even more so.  The breakfasts were delicious.  We also had one lunch and one dinner there, and both were good experiences.  On our first night they also had a little dance performance.  That was a nice extra.  They can arrange just about any kind of activity or excursion you can imagine, though you'll pay less if you arrange it on your own.  

Little things...
I was supposed to receive a free 15 minute massage, but it was never offered, and I forgot to ask about it.
Other than a decorative style seat, there is really nowhere to sit in the room itself, other than the bed.
Hot water, for coffee or tea, was delivered once a day at 5:00.  Would like to see it in the morning as well, though the thermos did somehow manage to keep it warm overnight.

Bottom line: I would definitely stay there again, and recommend it to others.
title: Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff

text:
Candidasa wasn't exactly what we were expecting when we first arrived from the Kuta area, I don't think there is an ATM in the village, but after settling in for the first night we absolutely loved the resort and the village.

We spent 3 nights at Alam Asmara with the intention of kicking back and relaxing.  The initial feel of the place is very calming with water features everywhere and only 12 rooms, all seperate and with outdoor bathrooms which we loved.

The room was very comfortable, though the mozzie net din't do a particually great job, we found we needed to sleep with insect repelant on tobe on the safe side.

The staff ther were very friendly although their english isn't as good as what we were sued to in other parts of Bali.

We organised a snorkling trip to Blue Lagoon through the resort and would highly recomend it to anyone! Perfect blue water and heaps of fish to see.

We really enjoyed our stay at Alam Asmara, it was exactly what we were after, a break away from the hustle and bustle of Kuta and a chance to really relax and enjoy som down time.
title: Relaxing, peaceful and away from the bulk of the tourists.

text:
I stayed here with my girlfriend and proposed to her here. The staff were very helpful to assist me with any romantic additions they could make to aid my proposal. The manager, Wayan, made sure to come speak with us every day.
The restaurant food and service were second to none. Lovely fresh fish and we didn't want to eat anywhere else. Best food in Bali by far! 
The rooms are small, but they have an outdoor bath/shower with hot water that adds to the whole love of nature that the hotel is expressing. Set in a Japanese style garden the rooms are surrounded by plants and water. The restaurant and pool are right on the sea's edge. 
Not a lot to do in Candidasa, except for diving and fishing, but its a good place for day trips to see the East/ North of Bali. 
They have all the services u need and every staff greats you with a big smile.
GREAT STAY, THANK YOU ALL AT ALAM ASMARA!
title: Fantastic service!

text:
Signposting to the hotel was not the greatest.  However, after a quick u-turn we were met by a very warm welcome from the hotel staff.  Check in was quick and we were offered a complimentary drink on arrival, which is a nice touch after the 1hr 45 min journey from the airport. 

The hotel is located 50 metres from the main road.  This adds to the peaceful vibe, along with the fact that each villa is detached and located either side of the pathway which leads to the pool and restaurant, which in turn overlook the sea.
.
The room was amazing, clean, and spacious with a fabulous outside bathroom.  The bed was very comfortable, with the added luxury of a mosquito net, which the hotel staff draped at night when they came in to turn down the beds.  Whilst there was not an electric kettle, tea/coffee was placed on the veranda with a hot water flask that always seemed to be replenished without you having to place a request.  A TV and fridge were located in the room and free wifi was available. 

The breakfast choice we made consisted of a fruit platter, choice of eggs, sausages, with toast, croissant and cake.  Tea, coffee and various fruit juices were also on offer. We didn’t have dinner in the restaurant however the menu looked varied and reasonably priced.

The staff were attentive and friendly.  The hotel has a spa and a dive shop implant.  Be sure to confirm prices in advance if you are a single diver as there will be an additional supplement to pay if you are the only diver (easily possible early or late in the season).  Compliments to my dive master, who took me to the US Liberty wreck, located at Tulamben.            

Great hotel which is ideally located as a base for excursions
title: A hidden Gem in Candi Dasa

text:
This boutique resort is something special – wonderful location on the water’s edge. Quite refreshing to find the staff so pleasant to make our stay such a delight. From the General Manager to the room staff – eager to please but not overpowering. Rooms were a dream – private exterior contemporary bathrooms befitting a 5-star hotel. An oasis with well maintained tropical grounds creating a truly pleasurable stay. Extra fresh fluffy towels for the pool & bathroom supplied every afternoon and much more. I have never seen hotel staff so smartly and suitably dressed. Asia at its best ! And only 12 rooms. No longer a secret ! A wonderful place to celebrate the Balinese New Year (Nyepi Day)
Thank you Wayan, Pande, Wati, Ratih and all the staff.
title: Something Special - Dream Accomodation with that uneqalled ambience

text: I picked this hotel from the reviews on Tripadviser, and would recommend it to any one either going to Candidasa or anyone wanting a relaxing place to stay, the resturant at the hotel is very nice, with a really nice sea view, its a bit more expensive than the ones along the main road, but well worth trying. The staff are all friendly and very helpfull.
title: Great Hotel

text:
Alam Asmara was our first place to stay on Bali and now, after traveling for a month around the island and changing 10 different locations and hotels I can really rate it as "THE BEST" in terms of price-quality.
The territory is so small but they took most of it turning small piece of land into such a beauty.
The cottages are very close to each other and initially we thought it will be to noisy but it turned out to be so private and relaxing there...
Built on a water channels, this resort drowns in flowers. Cottages are clean and beautiful, outside shower is also nice. Common areas are decorated with Hindu gods  and kamasutra scenes. Waterfront restaurant is not bad at all and some items on the menu are quite tasty, like mixed seafood platter.

Generally I can recommend this hotel for those who look for a calm serene atmosphere in traditional Balinese surroundings. Also I find this hotel very romantic despite lack of space for privacy - there is definitely something erotic about it.
title: Beautiful atmospheric small resort

text:
Alam Asmara Hotel is a small, stylish hotel located off the main street in Candidasa, East Bali. A tranquil seaside hotel with its beautiful restaurant 'Rendevouz' and swimming pool placed right next to the sea ( no sand beach but clear blue waters)  where you can listen to the sound of waves all day long while sitting comfortably sipping refreshing drinks, cocktails and indulging in some of their delicious dishes from the menu. Watch the sun set over some seafood served with coconut milk~rice, a recipe I have been cooking often at home since my return. 
The rooms are modern, all with an individual entrance and a small patio to sit, read and relax in privacy. All very clean and comfortable. 
The staff is extremely friendly, helpful and attentive. 
I also enjoyed the Spa and treated myself to several massages and found the treatment very skillful and professional.
All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and only can say: "try for yourselves!"
Thank you to the manager Wayan and all the staff!
title: Romantic Sea Side Hotel where you can dine in Style

text:
We stayed in at Alam Asmara for only two nights - unfortunately. This hotel is one of the nicest we have seen so far. You live in a nicely decorated and absolutely clean bungalow with a beautiful open-air style bathroom. The resort's compound is very green with lots of flowers and plants. The pool is spacious enough to swim some rounds.

Additionally, the staff is absolutely nice and kind always greeting you with a warm "Hello, how are you today?" Tours around the whole island can be easily booked at the reception.

Overall, this was a very relaxing and enjoyably stay which can be recommended to nearly anybody looking for a comfortable place on the east coast of Bali, independent of age and travel background.
title: Great place to stay - Beautiful bungalows, charming staff

text: Absolutely loved our stay here! The service team was amazing, especially the manager Wayan, who was so attentative and helpful. The rooms were very clean and we had an incredibly comfortable stay. Also must point out the Rendez-Vous restaurant at the hotel which was simply breathtaking. Such a lovely place great views and oh so romantic. Fabulous food too.  Can say nothing but the best about Alam Asmara, Candidasa !!
title: All rounder - service, atmosphere, fun and relaxation

text: My husband and I stayed at Alam Asmara for 2 weeks.If you wish to completely relax then this is place.No noise ,and so peaceful that you would never know that there were other guests staying.The rooms whilst not being large have an ambience that cannot be explained.The outdoor bathrooms are lovely always with plenty of hot water.The small terrace is adequate for 2 persons to sit and relax. The staff are always friendly and will go out of there way if you require anything.My husband had to have a doctor called and the staff did not hestitate to make sure all our needs were met ,enquiring about his foot on a daily basis. Although the restaurant was a little more expensive than places outside the food was good and the evening sunsets and the ambience at night more than makes up for it.The spa was also great value.Make sure that you meet Wayan from outside to take you to Blue Lagoon if you snorkel.It is well worth it. If you wish to go especially for diving I feel that this resort does not really cater for the diver.
title: A little piece of paradisw

text:
After researching on tripadvisor.com my wife and I  decided to book our stay via the internet.  The manager Wayan replied within a day and also followed up with more information after we requested it.  Great service.  

Alam Asmara is a beautiful small boutique resort.  The staff were fabulous, nothing was too much trouble and they always smiled.  The food at Rendezvous restaurant was superb !!!  some of the best tastes/food I have experienced in the last 10 or so years we have been visiting Bali.  The rooms were clean and spacious.

Although Alam Asmara does offer scuba diving services I would recommend going into town to book your trip.  Unfortunately Alam Asmara is linked to a dive company in Nusa Dua and although very professional, driving 1.5/2 hrs each way when you can dive the same sites from Padang Bai (10 mins down the road) is just ridiculous.  This would be my only concern for scuba divers.

Thank you Alam Asamra for our wonderful stay we will be back next year !!!
title: Beautiful resort with fabulous staff and great food

text:
This small, stylish 'Boutique~Hotel' sits tucked away only a short walking distance from the main street of Candi Dasa, East, Bali, directly on the sea side. 
     Here you can find an ambiance of tranquility, peacefulness, comfort, privacy, natural beauty in a tropical garden setting (the rooms are individually nested ~ each with a lovely patio ~ in between a 'water garden'); all combined with the opportunity to enjoy it also as a 'sea~side hotel.' 
     The pool and restaurant are directly located next to the sea and I enjoyed the fact that there is no sand beach as I find laying on sand irritating to the skin and itchy. So I could lay on a lounge~chair and listen to the sound of the waves...enjoy the colours and light variations of the water, sky and cloud formations...and just go down the stairs for a swim/snorkel in the crystal clear water whenever I felt like it. 
     The rooms are in light colours, lovely, comfortable and very clean. 
The restaurant is beautiful - always a breeze from the sea when it gets hot. 
The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful. Very well managed! Food very good too!
     If you enjoy sightseeing...it is not far to drive to the beautiful King's Palace of Ujung (one of my favourite sites!); also not far to theTirtagangga Water Gardens..and if you like to spend a day on the beach...no real distance to the very beautiful 'White Sandy Beach.' All in all ...plenty to explore in the area!
There would be a lot more to write and to say about this place but maybe it is best to come and see and experience the beauty yourself! 
     I have traveled a lot in the past 30 years - all over the world - and this one falls into the category: '...There are places I remember...' very fondly! Lets say 10/10!!! :~)
title: A Treasure for Pleasure....'there are are places I remember...'

photos.caption: ...on your way to your room...through a water garden setting
View from restaurant and pool to the West
View from restaurant and pool to the East
Restaurant and Pool * Alam Asmara Hotel

text:
We chose Alam Asmara on Trip Advisor recommendations and could not have made a better choice in Candidasa. Small, quiet and intimate, with great restuarant and excellent service, in good central location on the sea front. 
Rooms are well decorated and spotless and have great outdoor bathrooms and foliage screened verandahs. The pool and restuarant look out over the sea. 
Unfortunately the beach disappeared in the 80's but we didn't even miss it as there are other beaches near by if you're looking for sand.
The staff are the best thing at this hotel. Nothing was too much effort, and all our requests were fulfilled in the friendliest and most efficient manner.
We will certainly stay here again - hopefully very soon!!
title: Intimate and lovely

text: This place was gorgeouse to say the least.  Only 12 individual bungalows surrounded by fish ponds.  Beautiful rooms and bathrooms, some of the best in the world, and we are well travelled.  Staff are excellent and there for your every need.  From the restuarant to the turn down service in your room.  We received welcome drinks and a 15 minute spa massage on arrival.  Absolutely beautiful although there spa was quite expensive from what we had been using down in Sanur and Kuta.  However we strolled up to the main street and used the massage lady accross the road.  The location of the hotel is just beautiful, outlook is straight out to the islands, the sea is accessed by a staircase at the end of the pool and restuarant and is nice clear safe water to swim.  The pool is lovely and situated near the sea end of the hotel with the restuarant.  Absolute honeymoon material for anyone looking for a romantic getaway or a day or two out of the hustle and bustle of Bali's tourist areas.  I loved everything about this hotel except for its spa package prices.
title: Out of a storybook

text:
A quiet, private, lovely hotel in Candidasa. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated in Balinese style. The bed was very comfy. The food was the best I had in Bali. Kudos to the chef.  The hotel is on the ocean with no beach to speak of..... but one can swim during low tide. The views are great with a fabulous sunset.  Jamu Spa was wonderful.  
We will return.
title: A lovely little hotel

text: Excellent spot to come and relax and enjoy the view.  The rooms are clean and beautifully presented. The property is a little oasis. Very friendly staff who are always happy and helpful.  The breakfast was lovely and the food on the restaurant was delicious.   We booked for 3 nights and stayed for 6 Short stroll out to the street were there are some small shops and restaurants were the food was good and beautiful staff. I will definitely recommend this beautiful spot to come and chill and we are looking forward to our next visit .
title: An Oasis

text:
seriously lack of maintenance, unfortunately the rooms are nice but the cleanliness is not the highlight of this hotel. the staff is nice but it's not enough
It s very expensive for what they can offer...breakfast pour...i dont recommend
title: Too dark

text: Very comfortable and cosy hotel. We stayed in a room in front of the beach so it was very nice sleeping with the sound of the ocean. The staffs are very nice and thoughtful. The food  was amazing, we had the fish of the day and it was very fresh ! This hotel totally worth the price you pay !  Also they helped us arrange dive and we really liked the dive masters !
title: Very good and comfortable hotel

text: We were meant to have 6 nights at Alam Candi but with COVID 19 we could only have 1 as we had to get back to Australia. The 1 night we did have was fantastic. We had the first villa closest to the office and it was awesome. Even though there are upgrades going on it did not affect our stay at all. Our villa, as with all of them, was surrounded by fish ponds and lush tropical gardens. The room is large and spotless. There is a kettle, fridge and water bottle that is refilled when ever you want. The outside bathroom was also spotless and so much linen was supplied. The shower/ bath also had shower gel, shampoo and conditioner in refill bottles. We even had frogs on the wall in the shower. So great to see. The pool was lovely and clean and towels are provided for the pool and beach. The views across to Nusa Penida from your pool lounge are beautiful. As the restaurant and bar are closed at the moment you can still order cocktails from the front office and they are delivered to the pool. Happy hour still happens and with COVID 19 and quiet season, we were the only guests. It is a short walk up the lane to the main street of Candidasa for restaurants, shops and supermarkets. Breakfast was included and it is cooked to order so minimal food wastage. My Mee Goreng was delicious. As there are only 12 villas, it would feel like you are the only guests at any time. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and can't wait to head back to finish our stay once travel restrictions are lifted. Everyone that works at Alam Candi does their absolute best to make your stay enjoyable. A really beautiful resort.
title: Awesome Resort

text:
We booked this solely on basis of reviews online. We had no idea on neither the resort nor Candidasa as a place. We were disappointed in both. 
After a sweaty checkin procedure, we were guided through a moist path past the rooms.
Just minutes after entering the room, we were disappointed. The cleanliness in the room was not as expected. Or acceptable. What we considered to be sand below the bed, was explained as fallout from bugs in the wooden framing of the bed. Seriously. The aircondition had near to no function in cooling. 

The towels were dirty. Not just a stain. Once white, the towels were almost brown. We asked for new, wanting to have a shower. But were told we´d have to wait for towels coming out of the laundry, as they didnt have any available. 

After presenting our view on the situation, we were offered to change to another room. This was supposed to recently having been fogged for bug elimination. The first thing we noticed after entering this room was a creature on the floor. For us it looked pretty much like a cockroach, whilst the front-desk-guy insisted calling it an "insect" flying down from the trees. 

I dont know. Anyway, it was now clear that this resort was no place to stay for us. This was also clear for the nice guy on the front desk. He took the matter seriously. After a bit of organizing (for them) and waiting (for us), they accepted to cancel the reservation and refund the fare for the whole stay. Respect for this. 
We left late at night for another hotel, having learnt an important lesson about reading more than the reviews.
title: Disappointed touch&go

text: This place is an oasis small villas without TV's, the only sound is the fish flapping about within the walk ways. The staff are the friendliest that I have come against, nothing bothers them, they are on hand 24 hours. The breakfast is small in choice, but very acceptable. All in all a very noce place to stay.
title: Holiday break

text:
We did our first open water padi certification course with the khatulistiwah team Leon and kartina at the candidasa dive resort and had a fantastic experience for our first dive.
Having no real prior knowledge of diving they both made us feel at ease and ready by the time we finished our theory and pool practice sessions.

Our first dive was at the USS Liberty wreck in Bali at Tulamben  and what a magical first dive experience.

Leon was knowledgeable and very relaxed and taught and assisted in practising our first pool sessions. 

Kartina was so lovely in assisting to prep us for what was to come and support us before the dives and we highly recommend diving with them. 

I can't wait to come back for our next dives else where. Many thanks once more for an unforgettable first experience!
title: Open water padi diving course.

text: Alam Candi is a very relaxing place with friendly staff, beautiful view to the sea & Nusa Penida island. My most favorit is the Diving Crew of Khatulistiwa Dive @ktwbali #KhatulistiwaDive . They make the trip worry-free, fun, and memorable. Leon & Nina are definitely the best and reliable Dive Instructors. Not only they are attentive, funny, and friendly, they also know the best spots to dives! The equipment and facilities are very trustworthy and comfortable. Definitely coming back!
title: Relaxing place, easy access to dive spots

text: After many years travelling to Bali & staying on the western side of the island we decided to move around a bit & chose this unique little resort for 3 nights & we're not disappointed. It is a stunning surprise as you walk thru from reception the 12 beautiful bungalow style rooms sit either side of the lush path leading to the pool & restaurant right on the beach. We requested a room near the pool when booking & were given the first one! Rooms are large, beautifully styled with great air conditioning, comfy king bed, a safe, fridge & large indoor /outdoor bathroom with plenty of bottled water. The pool area & restaurant are beautiful relaxing areas any time of day. Great food & service from the lovely friendly & helpful staff. Would highly recommend this resort. Amazing value for money.
title: Simply amazing

text: The Alam Candi Dive Resort is a beautiful little resort with nice, clean rooms and breathtaking views. The restaurant breakfast is really good--the coffee is the best! The staff are fantastic-- very helpful and attentive. The service at the restaurant and concierge were great. I will definitely be visiting again.
title: Fantastic Resort

text:
Thank you for the beautiful week. We stay in this charming place with really friendly and helpful staff. We feel all the time like in a family. Special thanks around the staff at restaurant and the “cooking chef”. They bring all meal in a very good atmosphere and the food is very lovely celebrate like “Jamie Oliver” style :-) hope we all see us again at this beautiful “new” hotel. 
A long time we will remember you all!!! 
Jupp and Nina from Germany
title: Hotel mit besonderem Flair

text:
Alam Candi was the first place we stayed after arriving in Bali, and I was pleasantly surprised by how beautiful the rooms and setting were for the price we paid. The rooms are separate villas surrounded by koi ponds and set back off a leafy walkway, and feel very spacious and private. There is therefore next to no noise from neighbouring rooms, and because the property is down a track away from the main road, you also can't hear any traffic noise - just the sound of the sea in the distance! The semi-outdoor bathroom is lovely (I didn't see a single spider or insect in it the whole time - despite my concerns), although it does get a bit hot. 

The pool and restaurant area is nice too - unfortunately the pool loses the sun after around 3pm (ish) but is fine before then. The loungers down by the sea front also get a lovely breeze. The food we had in the restaurant was great, although we somehow got stung by the price of the seafood BBQ and ended up spending £72 on one lobster and one red snapper... Probably our fault for not doing the maths correctly, but the prices are a bit confusing. It was nice, but definitely not £72 worth of nice! 

My other issue with the restaurant is over the breakfast menu - it seems to be that if people walk in for breakfast they get a wider menu than those staying at the hotel. The breakfast menu on the front of the full lunch and dinner menu that you choose from later on in the day features things like avocado on toast, which was never available on the printed paper menu given to us at breakfast each day. It seems a bit odd to offer your paying guests less choice than those who walk in off the street, and also means the western options can be quite limited. One morning the granola and fruit option had run out, which only meant one western choice for us, so a bit restrictive. 

Otherwise a really enjoyable stay - and we both agreed that, in second place after the Viceroy in Ubud, this was our next favourite hotel of the holiday :-)
title: Lovely hotel in a nice spot

text:
It would be hard to beat the location, up against a sea wall with local boats moored only metres fron the dining area.  We were a little disappointed with the Saturday seafood bbq, and this prompted us to eat most of our meals in local warungs in the nearby alleys. Actually, when you spend $100 on a meal for 2 in Bali, it needs to be pretty good, and this wasn't.  
You'll get the same quality juices within 100m at less than half the price as well. We were happy to pay inner city Australian prices for our coffees the,  they did a good job there.
title: Beautiful setting, maybe a bit pricey - relatively

text:
After 30 hours traveling, we had a very warm welkom at Alam Candi with a fresh self made ice tea. We were guided to our room and (it was dark) we were very much supriced with this beautiful hotel and our villa.
The staff was very nice, because normally the kitchen is closing at 10 pm, but they left it open for us, so we could still have a meal.
Everybody is very friendly and caring and everything is super clean and perfect.
We highly recommand this hotel to anyone who is looking for a very nice stay at Bali.
In two words: stunning hotel!
This is by far the best en prettiest hotel we ever stayed (and we have seen a lot of hotels)!
Thank you Alam Candi for our very nice stay (and especally thank you Putu and the rest of the staff for your big smile every day!)
title: Stunning!

text: What a great location for our lunch stop yesterday, reasonable prices, good service and quiet, we enjoyed our brief visit and one of the people staying there showed us her villa very nice and comfortable
title: Lunch stop during tour

text:
We had a great 3 night stay here and enjoyed an incredible snorkeling trip using the dive center. Our guide was very knowledgeable and helpful showing us 3 green turtles in one area and taking us to different spots for the coral and sea life. We enjoyed swimming in the Blue Lagoon. 

The food at the restaurant was also a highlight, all very fresh and delicious. Highly recommend this hotel.
title: Relaxing trip with great snorkellng and dive center

text: A little piece of heaven in one of the most gorgeous parts of Bali. Every little detail has been considered in this place—from the design of the rooms to the delicious food & drinks. This is the perfect getaway spot if you’re looking for some time out & particularly wonderful for dive/snorkelling lovers. The staff are warm & friendly as are the lovely owners. Can’t recommend it enough & already planning a return visit. Thank you Alam Candi! 🙏🏼
title: The perfect getaway spot

text: This our third visit twice before when it was alam Asmara. It is without doubt the most relaxing place to stay , all new staff who are wonderful nothing is too much trouble for them , the rooms are gorgeous we stayed in room 112 which has two outside sitting areas one where you can watch the fish in your private pond . The outside bathroom is great with toiletries supplied . The restaurant is wonderful breakfast is plentiful with quite a few varieties to choose from dinner is also great with the wonderful outlook to the ocean , pool area very relaxing and with only 12 rooms it always has seating available . I cannot speak highly enough about the resort would highly recommend .
title: Beautiful

text:
We had 5 nights at this little resort. The rooms were perfect with a 4 poster bed with netting; great air con and an outside bathroom. The gardens were simply amazing and the pool area and cafe are right on the water front. Only 8 sun lounges around the pool which was pretty small but lovely all the same. Beautiful views across to Nusa Pendisa. Breakfast included which consisted of a small choice of options such as eggs fruit and pancakes. 
Staff were very attentive and eager to please. Not a lot to do in Candidasa itself but we went diving and then spent the day at Virgin Beach and also hired a driver to view some of the local attractions. 
Special mention to Kadek in the cafe. 
Would highly recommend. Rooms are just gorgeous.
title: Just Gorgeous

text:
Stayed here for 8 blissful nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The management should be extremely pleased with their staff as the service was fantastic. As it was so quite with few tourists when we stayed, it felt like we had a private villa with our own butlers. 
I cannot praise highly enough all staff here, but special mention for Wirdana, Putu, Made and young trainee Ayu (I hope they give you a job at the end of your studies as you deserve one - you were excellent at your job) - they were very personable, attentive and a delight to speak with. 
The restaurant there also has great food -best in Candidasa - presented beautifully and very tasty.
title: Bliss

owner_response.text:

Management will be sure to pass on your kind words directly to Wirdana, Putu, Made and Ayu.

Our restaurant, Dasa by the Sea, is certainly gaining popularity in the Candidasa region and we are glad that you concur.  The surroundings are certainly breathtaking and the food and beverages equally so.

thank you again for your kind review and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Really amazing! Candidasa itself is lovely and without all of the crowds of Ubud or Seminyak. A stay here was very relaxing, comfortable, and quiet:)This place would make an excellent destination for a wellness retreat! 
It has the most beautiful view overlooking the ocean where the fishermen return each morning with their catch. Easily within walking distance to restaurants and massage spas, and the dive center.The food is fantastic! Healthy made to order, fresh everything, fruit veggies, and fish superb - from the ocean or gardens to your plate! And breakfast was ah-mazing,  reallycan't say enough- thank you Molar, and all of the staff!!!

We stayed in a villa room that  sits and along the suspended walkway over a coy pond, so relaxing to sit on the porch and watch the coy swim in and out under the bouganvilla and palm trees. The walkway leads out to the sea, and the restaurant with an absolutely beautiful fresh water pool to swim about in. Luxurious. We could hear the quiet waves of the sea from the room. The AC was working well, there was mosquito netting, and no mosquitoes  seem to be about;)

The local swim spot where the boats leave is a block away along the sea wall, where villagers go in the afternoon to cool off and gather, you can hear them communing and laughing softly from the restaurant overlook. Its an easy  place to hire a fisherman to take you snorkeling or adventure to the white sand beach not far away. Drivers are also in the area for hire for easy day trips to temples, the bee farm, markets or Tenganan ancient village  only a very short drive. 

The staff are excellent and really makes you feel welcome and valued. I can highly recommend this magical place for anyone wanting to visit Bali - It is truly special and you will not be disappointed!
title: A little slice of Heaven:)

owner_response.text:
Dear Erin L

thank you so much for taking the time to provide such a comprehensive review of our little jewel, Alam Candi Resort.

your summary certainly captures the essence of the property, its surroundings and the wonderful staff who work here.

We have taken great joy in sharing your review with our dedicated staff and they are full of pride.  for that alone, we thank you.

we truly look forward to welcoming you back as soon as possible.

warm regards

Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

photos.caption: Dining , and pool on the right with view of the sea!!!
Walkway over the coy pond between villas and out to the pool and restaurant and the sea

text: I stayed at Alam Candi during the off-season and it was so quiet and romantic not only at the hotel but in the town centre. The resort is situated in an amazing location (could not get better) and is absolutely immaculate in regards to the cleanliness, the gardens, and the finer details of your stay. We had our laundry done while at the hotel and it was washed, dried, and pressed within a couple of hours. The hotel itself is so breathtaking and well kept. The staff take to much pride in insuring there is not one leaf out of place. The frangipanis drop into the pool and pond water and on the footpaths and it looks so magical. All the villas are surrounded with ponds filled with catfish and carp as well. In Australia this resort would exceed 5 star ratings - i’ve stayed in a lot of luxury resorts and this is one of my absolute favourites. This is the best resort we have stayed at in Bali this far and is a fraction of the price of other luxury hotels. The food is also wonderful and immaculately presented. To top it off, the staff are the kindest and most helpful people you will meet. Putu is a young wait staff at the resort and he was so helpful and genuinely kind - it made our stay so welcoming. Thanks so much for having us!
title: Immaculate Romantic Stay

owner_response.text:

It was of great pleasure to have you stay with us and truly we are looking forward to welcoming you again hopefully soon in the near future. Take care and thank you once again

Warmest regards,

Alam Candi Dive Resort family

text:
A beautiful small resort in the centre of Candidasa. The resort has been renovated only a few months ago and shines in white and blue colours. The rooms/pavilions are very cosy, clean, bright and the outside bathroom add an extra flair to it. Staff from the Front Desk to the Service team has been exceptional. A special note to Komang who took excellent care of us.

Great spot also for sunsets, if you wish to have only a drink there while passing through Candidasa. Otherwise, if you are spending time in the area, I highly recommend to stay here

Thanks for the lovely 10 days in your resort, we had a great time!!

The staff were all great and nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend Alam Candi if you are travelling to Candidasa!

text:

A quiet little bar/restaurant and beautiful accommodation. 
The cocktails and food are to die for, not to mention the views, we visited at sunset on a few occasions and once at lunch. Even though we wasn’t staying here we was told that we were more than welcome to come back during the day and use the pool and the sun beds. 
My thanks again goes to Made Kemul for introducing us to this wonderful spot, we will be back. 
Will and Karen.

Beautiful comfortable screened bed was inside the villa. No tv or radio, the sound of the ocean lulled you to sleep. Just a few minor issues- facilities were not explained to us, so we had no idea that tea and coffee was located in the cupboard on our verandah; towels were not changed despite being left on the bath as requested; mosquitoes were a problem. Overall the place was immaculate and inviting.
