owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Alam Asmara is the place we enjoyed most on our trip to Bali.  We have never stayed in Candi Dasa before in all our years of going to Bali and Lombok, boy what a mistake.!
Apart from the nicest staff members and such caring service, the meals were possibly the most consistently good food we have ever come across having such a wonderful balance of flavours and the portions were just right.  Really delicious.
The resort also was so tranquil and relaxing.  There is no beach in the front but really not necessary. You can lie by the pool and if you feel like a boat ride, there are steps down to waiting local boats only too keen to take you somewhere to dive or snorkel or just swim. 
The rooms aren't huge but so well designed like the whole resort which is also not huge, that you have a feeling of space and comfort where nothing is overlooked for your stay. Open air bathrooms, very comfortable beds and efficient air conditioning, a little front verandah to have you afternoon tea on surrounded by fish ponds and very friendly large goldfish, what am I missing if anything?  I could not fault this Resort and can't wait to go back next year.
title: Words fail me   13/10

text:
almost at the end of the alley leading to the sea you will fiend a well kept breathtaking gem
a place hard to leave later on
as a couple you must try the romantic package to be even more sublimely pampered
Alam Asmara's smiling team is always at your service with the 'rendez-vous' resto as icing on the mouthwatering cake
enjoyed every minute of our 4 days which were too fast gone
but we dream already to be back one day
title: Go unprejudiced

text: After coming from Fawlty Towers this place was like heaven. Beautiful rooms with everything you need, compact but all there. Good quality fittings & linen, very comfortable bed. Nice pool but a bit tight for sun baking. Right on the water front with a restaurant. Also has a diving operation for the sporty.
title: Tranquil

text: Just stayed with my wife in the Alam Asmara for two nights. A super, small, condensed 'gem' close to the Candidasa temple and a small lake. Very romantic rooms with all amenities expected. All rooms are the same. Excellent, professional staff and, above all .... a great restaurant with a perfect service. Breakfast with a super view on the four little islands in the sea. A boutique type of hotel. Just one funny thing: for the romantic dinner, the couple is put on a little stage ... next to the swimming pool.
title: A 'Gem' in Candidasa

text:
our first stay in candidasa and one we will repeat often i hope.  this small beach village reminds me of how bali used to be.  

the staff were friendly and helpful, rooms very comfortable, and the piece de resistance was the pool overlooking the ocean.  we swam in clear water which was safe and perfect, descending a few steps to the ocean (enclosed by a large wall).  i loved the curry in rendezvous restaurant too - so much so i ate it 3 times!
title: ocean bliss and best curry

text: Just spent the last 5 nights at this hotel. It was lovely. Suspended walkways over water, filled with coy carp, leading to only 12 bungalows. The infinity pool overlooks the sea, alongside the restaurant. The staff were very attentive and called us by our first names the whole time we were there. The service and food were great. The only negative we had was there was nothing in the rooms regarding tours or excursions. Or any info on local attractions. Everything else was just great. A perfect 2nd part of our honeymoon.
title: Absolutely fantastic

text: I totally love this place. A wonderful oasis at the end of a quiet lane. The restaurant if fabulous, the staff attentive an the view of the sea divine. My partner loved the fish ponds and even went and bought them some food. I had two amazing massages and can thoroughly recommend the lime scrub. Although the little huts are fairly close to each other you feel totally private. I also love the outdoor bathroom. All in all probably almost my favourite place I stayed in Bali. We also took a scooter and followed the coastline up to Amed and it was wonderful, very quiet and hardly any other traffic on the road.
title: Beautiful and luxurious

text: I cannot help but return to Alam Asmara. I keep returning because of the quality of the service, attention to detail, clean rooms, peace and quiet, the wonderful Rendezvous Restaurant, the location on the sea, the beautiful garden and fish ponds, the amazing view overlooking the sea and little islands and the wonderful welcoming staff. The time flew by because I love to swim, snorkel and go out in the traditional boat to the many excellent snorkelling locations and many days relaxing at White Sand Beach. I also enjoy walking in the nearby Samuh Village with the myriad coconut trees, banana trees, chickens and the friendly villagers. It's on a flat surface and the staff can tell you where to go as it's a beautiful round trip half hour walk. I also like visiting the shops for souvenirs on the main road and presently the footpaths are being renovated. Alam Asmara is in a great location to see the sites and is not on the main road (no traffic noise whatsoever. The included breakfast consists of any style eggs, fresh fruit juice or tropical fruit, a basket consisting of toast and pastries and there is even oats, yoghurt, fruit, toast. The lunch and dinner menu is varied and delicious. Try the Italian jumbo cappuccino brought on a tray with biscuits. Everything is so beautifully presented - attention to detail. For example some days there is a towel decoration on the huge king sized bed or flowers and he bed turned down at night and the mosquito net drawn but there are no mosquitoes as there is air conditioning and the hotel is regularly fumigated. The rooms have good bedside lights, TV, phone etc. I love snorkelling in the lagoon at medium tide and there are steps leading down to the water at the sea front of the hotel. There is no beach but sun beds and umbrellas face the sea. The pool is sparkling clean and the garden and public areas are always being cleaned. This is a small 12 room hotel and all rooms are private with tea and coffee. The bathroom is spacious and water pressure and temperature is very good. There is an in room safe and I find that there is sufficient cupboard space. Pack lightly because the hotel offer an inexpensive laundry service and being Bali, it is casual dress. This hotel is romantic and intimate and great for young honeymooners; a great venue for a small wedding; and those seeking a relaxing holiday. I was travelling solo this time but I never felt lonely. The management had even placed a framed photo of my husband and I together on the bedside table on arrival! Now, that's what I call good customer service for a repeat client and extremely thoughtful. Also if it happens to be your birthday and even if you don't inform the staff, they note this from your passport and you will be presented with a birthday cake and a rendition of the "Happy Birthday" song from the sweet staff. The hotel can arrange all of your tours, diving/or diving lessons, and will go to great lengths to please you, even helping me with my mobile phone problem. The Management also have a social conscience and support an orphanage in Amlapura. I have already travelled around Bali previously and I was just happy to relax, read 4 books, swim, snorkel at this gorgeous hotel with the wonderful Balinese staff. You can also see a Balinese dance display on 2 nights of the week and when there are important ceremonies you'll see the placement of offerings at the shrines located in the grounds. The hotel spa is also very good. Alam Asmara is value for money and it never ceases to surprise me and I will keep returning to this "haven" in East Bali.
title: Two Weeks in "Heaven"

text:
I'm a little late with my review, but this gem of a resort deserves many accolades!  My husband and I stayed here, sadly only for 2 nights 11th & 12th May. As our airline failed to check our baggage through to Bali, it wasn't the best start to our holiday.  However, arriving at this beautiful resort was very calming.  Check-in was very efficient and we were then showed to our lovely room.  The room, I thought, was far more spacious than appeared on their website.  Also a very spacious semi-outdoor bathroom.  Everything was spotlessly clean, with lovely quality sheets and good mosquito net.  Although, we didn't see a single mosquito during our stay. Whilst dining on our first night, a Balinese dancer provided entertainment, which was really nice.  Most smaller resorts don't often bother with this and I think it's a nice touch.  The food here is of a very good standard and we also liked that we could order breakfast from a menu.  As we didn't have our suitcase delivered until our last day, we will just have to go back to have a swim in the amazing large lagoon that remains when the tide goes out.  The resort has steps down to the sea and many people were snorkelling and swimming in this beautiful and unique lagoon.  They also have a wonderful swimming pool.  Mustn't sign off without thanking the wonderful staff at this resort.  All extremely efficient and friendly.  We also had a excellent massage at the Spa.

Jacqui & Mike
New Zealand
title: A Perfect Boutique Gem

text:
My husband and I ended up booking Alam Asmara at the last minute after having a horrible experience at villas down the road in Candidasa. We were so glad we ended up staying at Alam Asmara, it really made our honeymoon. 
The staff were absolutely amazing and extremely accommodating. I couldn't fault the villas or the rendezvous restaurant next door.
We had a honeymoon table on the first night and a special cake presented to us. We also had our room made up with petals and flags as you enter. 

I couldn't praise the staff enough for such a wonderful experience. We will definitely be coming back and bringing our family along with us next time. 

Thank you Alam Asmara!
title: Absolutely amazing honeymoon spot

text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. We stayed in various other places around Bali, including Ubud and Semanyaki. But this place was our favorite. It was peaceful, beautiful and unique. The staff was fantastic and the location superb. I really could not fault this place. You get what you pay for. Beautiful individual villas with a wonderful pool and a great restaurant directly overlooking the water. The town is cute as well and it has a few decent restaurants. For here there is several good tourist attractions that you can get to easily and that are not crowded. We loved the water palace. I hope one day I can return to this beautiful place.
title: Perfect honeymoon spot

text:
We loved that place the moment we arrived there. The staff is super friendly and helpful, the 12 little bungalows are well maintained, very clean and cozy and feature a nice private "outdoor bathroom".  The resorts restaurant is directly located at the edge of the sea, providing great views and superb food at a good price - well the rich and nicely arranged breakfast is even included in the room charge :-)  - the service again:great. The resort is setup like a little tropical garden with water floating "everywhere" and kois (fish) swimming in it - feeding them is big fun :-). Also the massage and further treatment at the spa is excellent.
One more thing which also very impressed us: When we called them a couple of days before we stayed there because we were worried that we made a mistake - ignorant as we were, we had planned to leave the place on "Silent Day" (strictly nobody is allowed on Bali's streets that day)  - they had already taken care of us and prolonged our reservation by one day and even contacted Agoda (booking service) on this  - 5 stars also for this :-)
title: Just: GREAT!

text:
We are very happy to stay at this hotel, peaceful atmosphere very friendly staff, close to the beautiful beach "Virgin White Sandy Beach"
When we were in the room we prefer to spend time to sleep and watch tv or listen to the rush of water from the pond-lovely small pool just below the terrace, an open window.
Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner are very Indonesian. I love this hotel.
Would suggest to my friends. Will return :-)
title: lovely boutique resort

text: We travelled with my stepdaughter (20) and her boyfriend (25) for their first ever visit to Bali and Alam Asmara. We had (3) nights at Alam Asmara. They fell in love with Alam Asmara and Candidasa. They were celebrating 2 years of "dating" and the hotel decorated the room with flowers and a huge love heart on the verandah plus a cake with "happy anniversary". On the day they also set up a dinner table adjacent to the sea with decorated chairs. They also had a couple's massage at the Spa beforehand which they both adored. They loved the friendly staff and the king sized bedroom, bathroom and balcony. My husband and I had been worried that they may find Candidasa too quiet but quite the contrary. They didn't want to leave and when we stayed in Sanur they wanted to turn around and return to Alam Asmara which surprised me. We had been in the fishing boat to snorkel, White Sand Beach, Tirta Ganga, feeding peanuts to the roadside monkies on the hill about 10 minutes from the hotel, shopping at Hardy's in Amlapura and relaxing by the pool at Alam Asmara. As other reviewers have mentioned the standard of accommodation, comfort and surroundings is excellent and well maintained. Nothing is too much trouble for the wonderful staff who genuinely want to make your holiday as enjoyable as possible with nothing too much trouble. The restaurant is well appointed overlooking the sea and lagoon and has some of the best views in Candidasa. Breakfast is included in the tariff and after trialling a buffet breakfast, reverted to the al a carte menu (American, Continental with fresh juice or fruit) which is the better option. We have stayed at Alam Asmara many times now and will continue to stay here for future trips. It is so peaceful, relaxing, comfortable with tasty food at the restaurant and great cappuccinos. It is in a great location to the main street that runs through Candidasa making it accessible to the shops and restaurants or a leisurely stroll. The good thing is that Alam Asmara is set back from the road and there is no traffic noise whatsoever. Thank you to everyone at Alam Asmara and we will be back again.
title: Return Visit & Still a Fantastic Boutique Hotel.

text: Perfect retreat from  busy south Bali. As someone who loves smaller run hotels this place met all my expectations. It was one of our favorite places on our trip. Staff is so friendly. It was so nice to chat and get to know people while hanging out by the pool or sipping on a drink at the restaurant.  Grounds were lush and well kept as people were picking up throughout the day. The pond surrounding the pathway and bungalows made it a very relaxing environment, The rooms were very clean with morning cleaning and turn down services done very promptly. The on sight restaurant was delicious and affordable. So nice to be able to easily have a dinner and watch a beautiful sunset over the ocean. So much better than one of the large 5 star resorts we stayed at. Thank you to such a wonderful, friendly, and attentive staff making our stay here ideal. The price can't be beat either.
title: Perfect Getaway

photos.caption: lush pathway towards pool and restaurant. Rooms Along each side
Early Morning moon from the restaurant

text:
My husband and I have now stayed for the 3rd time in Alam Asmara, (something we normally wouldn't do as we enjoy experiencing variety). However despite the large number of lovely Hotels & accommodation available in Candi Dasa, we strongly feel we could not find better. If you are looking for a stunning location & views of the ocean,  a magical experience in a peaceful setting away from the hustle & bustle of the main street - this is it! It starts with a welcome drink upon arrival, towels on your king size bed sculptured daily into swans, elephants, etc..., flower petals on your bed, complimentary bottled water daily, exceptionally friendly & helpful staff who go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The staff are ever so thoughtful and are truly exceptional people, often working outside their busy day job to improve themselves and/or to work as volunteers in local orphanages & schools. Their English is very good & they are constantly trying to improve their service. 
The Rendezvous Restaurant deserves a special mention. The food is exceptional, very economical for its quality & portions. We have tried other restaurants & Warungs which were more highly rated on Trip Advisor but found Rendezvous vastly superior and suspect it doesn't rate more highly because it is hidden away from the main street. 
We note that one reviewer rated the breakfast as average. We strongly disagree, there are several choices ranging from American/Continental/Oatmeal breakfast to Indonesian, which we found large, fresh, and extremely satisfying. In any event we were regularly reminded by the restaurant staff, if we wanted anything different or extra, we only had to ask. 
We enjoyed the snorkelling from the hotel steps & lovely late night swims in the pool.
title: Nothing less than a 5 star boutique Hotel in Australia!

text: Having stayed now a number of times at this boutique accommodation , I still have nothing but the highest praise for it. The standout aspect for me is the high quality of the staff, from the bottom to top, everyone has a smile, time and interest in talking to you and eagerness to make sure your stay is everything you need It to be. To be frank, I have never stayed elsewhere and had this level of service and friendliness. When you combined that with lovely single dwellings surrounded by lush vegetation and he sound running water together with seaside pool and restaurant, you know that you are in a VERY SPECIAL PLACE.  The restaurant serves remarkable food, beautifully presented at a more than reasonable price fortis high quality. Will we be back? You bet,
title: Outstanding warm and personal service

text:
having stayed in candidasa only once before many years ago , I did some internet research on hotels In candidasa and decided on the alam asmara dive resort ' my wife and I absolutely loved it,  the rooms were very comfortable the bathroom was very good with plenty of hot water,
the restaurant was wonderful with breakfast and a great ocean view ,the dinner menu was quite impressive and the food was very good , all the staff could not do enough for you always asking if their were  any problems no matter how small ,agus who met us at reception was a credit to the hotel always had time for a chat , we will recommend this hotel to all friends and family for there next stay in candidasa; thank you for a wonderful stay
title: 5 days of bliss

text: My fiancee and I stayed 1 night at this hotel as we had to depart from Padangbai the following day in order to reach Gilli Trawangan. Overall we had a very good stay, especially if you are looking for peace and quiet. The room are small but they are nicely furnished and cleaned. Moreover, the personal at the reception have a good level of English (not the case in the restaurant). However, the breakfast buffet isn't varied enough that was the only bad point.
title: Looking for very good service and relaxation place? Go for it!

text:
A gem of a place, beautiful architecture, quiet and secluded but right on the ocean, extremely friendly, professional and helpful staff will make you feel right at home. Great food! Great spa !!
Priced very reasonably for its quality. Don't forget to hire the fishermen's boat for a day of snorkeling on the White Sand Beach nearby.
title: Excellent !!

text: We have been travelling around Asia on our honeymoon and selected Alam Asmara for our final few days in Bali. It is a beautiful place with simply excellent service - you would not believe the effort all of the staff have gone to when we said it was our honeymoon: they had decorated the outside of the room with flowers leading up to the door and had made the room up specially (it was so sweet and really lovely). They also specially setup a table for us at dinner with a welcome drink - all of this for no additional charge, but we happily spent a long evening at their great restaurant because of this! My wife is going to the spa this evening and we are both going for a 'couples massage' tomorrow (which we are looking forward to!) - I cannot recommend this place more, especially to any couple on their honeymoon :-)
title: It completed our honeymoon!

text: Excellent location with direct access to the ocean. Small and beautiful designed resort, you can even snorkel in front of it. The food is a dream. The staff is friendly and always aware of your wishes. Don't miss the spa! Book on time. Thank you, Mudi and team! Will come again.
title: marvelous place, great food, friendly and professional staff

text: Since the Alam Asmara was the cheapest hotel of our trip we expected something nice (according to the ratings and experiences here on tripadvisor) but not such a beautiful and enchanting little resort right next to the sea. You will immediately relax once you walk the little board walk - over a canal system with fish which surrounds the villas - towards the seafront restaurant. We enjoyed our tropical evenings on our terrace behind a "wall" of greens listening to the cry of the gecko. The restaurant was very good as well and the prices were very reasonable. If I ever get the chance to come back to Bali I would love to stay at the Alam Asmara again!
title: Simply magic

text:
We spent our last 3 days of holiday at Alam Asmara, after a pretty bad 3 days in Gili T.  We found it peaceful and relaxing which is just what we wanted, having had food poisoning in Gili T.  Had this been at the beginning of our holiday I think it would have been too quiet and 3 days was plenty of time here. 
The resort is very small, maybe 10 villas, a small restaurant and a small pool with about 10 sunbeds.  There is no beach but steps leading down to the sea.  The views are beautiful.
The rooms are pleasant, nothing spectacular - a comfortable bed, wardrobe, TV and outside bathroom.  The outside bathroom was ok, it was sheltered with a roof and bamboo blinds so it didn't feel completely outside.  My only issue with this is Mosquitos - be careful, they're everywhere!
The food in the restaurant was very good.  I wasn't overly impressed with the breakfast.  My boyfriend and I both ordered the continental breakfast on our first morning and were given a basket with 2 slices of toast, 1 croissant, 1 tiny muffin and another small pastry.  After that we ignored the set menu and just ordered what we wanted.
The spa is nice.  We had a facial and the couples massage which were both good, the manicure wasn't great though.
The staff are super friendly, they really do a lot to make the resort a special place.  We ordered pizza one evening from outside and they delivered it to our door.
There are also plenty of local guys around who will take you out snorkeling if you like, I'd recommend this, its surprisingly fun and you can see plenty of fish, you also get to chat to the locals and find out more about their lifestyles.
I really enjoyed my stay at Alam Asmara, it seems to reflect the laid back and relaxed Candidasa.  It was perfect for the last few days of our trip.
title: Very peaceful and quitet

text:
Alam Asmara is a very nice hotel in the not soo crowded village of Candidasa. Candidasa in itself has not much interest but is a perfect central location to explore the beautiful east side of Bali. Many temples and sites to visit from there: Beautiful coastline road up to Amed, temple of Besakih, Tennangan village, Tirta Ganga, Ujung water temple. And many beautiful walks in the jungle and most beautiful rice terraces of Bali. I spent 5 days there and did something magical everyday.
The staff at Alam Asmara is very friendly and attentive and makes sure every aspect of your trip is pleasant. The bungalows are charming, and this boutique hotel offers all the calm and quiet you may desire. Although the property is rather small the set up is beautifully done and each bungalow is nestled in vegetation and feels very private. It is composed of a large bedroom with a gigantic, super comfortable bed, a nice outdoor bathroom and a little veranda. Room was super clean and lovely. Maybe lacking a little bit of light. Restaurant is very good overlooking the sea, although there is no beach access per say, but you can easily go snorkeling or take a trip to the beautiful white sand beach directly from the deck of the hotel with one of the local fish boat. Mr Belly, a great local guide is there to offer some boat trip and treks thru the jungle and rice fields, which is a must do while you're there.
There is also a nice spa where you can indulge in massages.
title: Quiet & Relaxing place to explore east Bali

text: We are staying at the alam Asmara for 2 nights what a wonderful resort.  Listening to the ocean while having dinner or just for a swim in the pool very serene.  The staff are wonderful and the price is very good out here.  Would recommend if you just want to getaway from the hustle and bustle of kuta.
title: Ocean views

text: Considering the reasonable price, it cannot be better than that!  Everything was perfect: food, people, view, room... the dream!  On top of that, take a short trip to Blue Lagoon (using one of their local boats) to see the clownfish, the reef is beautiful.
title: Fantastic!

text: We stayed at this hotel for 9 days and we absolutely loved it. The bungalows are perfectly adequate, with a lovely big bed (very comfortable matress) and semi-open bathrooms. The staff are amazing: friendly and accommodating. At the premise, there is a nice infinity style pool with views over the sea, and a dive center (thoroughly recommend booking dive if you are able to). Food at the restaurant is superb. All in all, this resort is gem and we would love to come back one day.
title: What a wonderful hotel!

text:
This Resort is outstanding The service second to none
From the time I made our booking on line I knew this Hotel would deliver
Tucked down a small lane of the main drag in Candidasa you hear no traffic no dogs or roosters only the sea and frogs
The chalets or villas (12) what ever you would descibe them are a decent size with and outside bathroom so when you take that into consideration the footprint is very good
all villas have alot of greenery infront of them that gives privacy
the walkway leads to the swimming pool and the restaurant that overlooks the sea
the staff froom check in to houseboys and girls to the wait staff are so friendly
Martid does an amazing job every morning checking with guests as to what they have planned or what he can arrange for them This Guy is Gold to any organisation and is a pleasure to watch him operate his guest relation skills are great
we arrived as guesta and left as friends we will return
this area of Bali is quiet no clubs but if you are looking to unwind chill out lap up the sun and the breeze do some snorkling this is a must
Thankyou so much
title: Wow Wow Wow

text: Stayed three nights and loved the resort. Rooms are small but not too small. Bed very comfortable. TV channels limited, but free DVD provided by reception. Had trouble with the first one supplied, but it was replaced quickly without fuss and lots of apologies. Food at the restaurant was fantastic and cheap. Driks too. Great variety of places nearby to eat and have a drink as well. Area is very quiet, but great for relaxing and exploring the East coast of Bali.
title: Fantastic room, private outdoor bathroom and great pool and restaurant

text: If you are after a most delightful location, excellent service, somewhere special.... then this is the place. Nice after the hub bub of Seminyak, terrific place to chill out. The surroundings are superb and rooms are individually located so the you feel as if you are on your own, lovely gardens and the outlook at breakfast is superb even though you may get a wave in your face at high tide, will be back!Only one complaint and that is the mattress was a little worn. Not far away is White Sands Beach which is is a great place to visit and get a massage from the gentleman that has been there for years. Food wise Candidasa is a little behind the rest but made up for by the rest of the package.
title: Delightful

text: We loved this hotel. It was beautiful walking down to the rooms along the pathway, the outdoor bathroom was fab and well done and the pool/restaurant has great views. We went on a hike with a tour guide organized by the hotel (Mr Belly) and that was also excellent - entertaining guide, really good English and helpful. To top it all off, this place was such good value!
title: What a little gem!

text:
We spent 4 nights here at the end of August and really enjoyed the resort.
The rooms were very nice, with a comfortable bed and quiet air conditioning and we liked the outdoor bathroom style. It was quiet and relaxing to listen to the sounds f the ocean.
Gardens were beautiful and the pool was great, it is a beautiful location looking over the ocean. We had considered joining a day of diving or snorkelling but decided not to when we were there (as we were joining a live aboard dive boat afterwards to Komodo) and we never felt pressured to join a tour either which is refreshing. 
All staff were very friendly with great service - they even arranged a birthday cake for me. The food was good, we enjoyed the Indonesian breakfasts and also joined the cooking class. We did eat out at other restaurants whilst we were there which was good for variety. The spa was also very good. 
Overall we chose this resort based on other TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed and would stay here again.
title: Relaxing stay, great staff

text: Staff wers so friendly and accommodating. Best thing though was the peace and quiet! NO BARKING DOGS!! Falling asleep to the sounds of the ocean and frogs was absolute bliss. The bungalows were cute and great value for money. Gardens well maintained. Ponds just lovely. You may have to fight for a pool lounge that's not in the shade but I had no problems.  Would definitely stay here again if I'm in the area. Bug thumbs up.
title: Fell asleep to the sounds of frogs and the ocean

text:
We have just spent 4 days at Alam Asmara, we had only booked for 2 but extended to 4 as it was a perfect place to relax and be cared for. 
The property is very cleverly and tastefully designed, the 12 bungalows are placed strategically in quite a small space to maximise privacy and comfort. Each villa is appointed extremely well, the beds are very comfortable and the linen is very good quality. The outdoor bathroom is lovely creating a blend of garden and building. 
The pool and restaurant, which served beautiful food and divine juices are situated beautifully overlooking the ocean, a perfect location for passing the time of day. 
The property is spotless, even down to dusting the plants outside the bungalows, the cleaning and maintenance staff were continually working and keeping Alam Asmara in "as new" condition. 
The staff were amazing, I inadvertently threw out a document I needed and the wonderful cleaner searched through the rubbish, found the paper and ironed it flat, fantastic service.
Agus and Made on the reception desk went above and beyond to help us when a suitcase hadn't arrived after our flight from Australia, continually calling an airport number that took forever to answer. Also making a booking for us on the fast boat to the Gilis, and then cancelling it and rebooking for another day, again another number that took so many calls and much time to get an answer, and all with a smile. They asked us many times if we were happy with  everything and certainly would have bent over backwards to rectify any problems had their been any. Their professionalism and service could not have been better. 
Candidasa is perfectly located to reach the Gili Isles and has a good selection of very reasonably priced warungs within a few minutes walk of Alam Asmara. 
We could not fault anything about Alam Asmara and highly recommend it.
title: Excellent property with personal touch

text:
We have been  regular visitors to Bali for over twenty years, we have visited Candi Dasa on day trips but have never stayed overnight,this year we decided to start our month long stay with a fews days at Candi Dasa to unwind. , we decided  on five days and after a bit of research decided on the Alam Asmara Dive Resort . We were not disappointed..A great ocean view , the reataurant is almost on top of the ocean , as the sea walls have reclaimed some land. .Lovely bungalows with huge mosquito nets around a very comfortable bed. Good for snorkelling at low tide , but a boat ride takes you to offshore islands where there is great snorkelling.   The staff wre very friendly and helpful . Candi Dasa is more suited for couples as there are not many activities for young children The Rendevous Restaurant was great , overlooking the ocean and watching the waves pound in . A good location for further exploration of the east coast 
and various inland attractions . A very professionally run resort , would certainly stay there again .
title: location  location

text:
We really enjoyed our 5 nights at Alam Asmara. The resort is small (12 bungalows) and has a very relaxing vibe. The daily breakfasts (included in our rate) were lovely - you order the night before for speedy service in the morning. Generally, the food at the resort was very good - complemented by a lovely ocean view!

I loved the pool and it's outlook to the ocean. There were always lounge chairs available and the area has lots of shady/sunny parts to choose from. 

The rooms are very well maintained and clean. The semi-outdoor bathroom was lovely and very private/secure -  nice to have the air coming in. There is a nice seating area outside that is pleasant to sit at, and the restaurant was happy to supply us with ice for early evening drinks (very appreciated!). The walls were a tad thin when there were kids next door (side note: I wouldn't bring kids here - the rooms are adequate for 2 people but it'd be a stretch with any more, and there are lots of other kid-friendly places in Bali. This is lovely for couples and adult children - for which the resort caters perfectly).

Alam Asmara is located in a good spot within the town, and it's an easy walk to lots of outside restaurants and there's a supermarket a short walk (5 mins) where we bought supplies from. Smaller shops are close by. 

If you're looking for a relaxing break away from the crowds, this is a great choice! We were pleased with our stay.

We also went fishing one morning with a fisherman who moors his boat in front of the restaurant. You start early (6am) so you see the sunrise and we caught a mahi mahi. I'd highly recommend this - it was a lovely trip and the restaurant will cook the fish for you (although I thought that was very pricey considering we supplied the fish)! Worth doing if you like fishing.
title: Lovely resort with good facilities

text:
I had a last minute trip to Candidasa and made the mistake of staying elsewhere because I thought Alam Asmara was full as my trip co-incided with the high season in July. I stayed at another hotel where the price of the room although a little cheaper worked out to be roughly similar. When I visited Alam Asmara, Made at reception was able to accommodate me for 10 nights so I moved. There was no comparison between where I was and Alam Asmara. The location is fantastic, close to the main street of Candidasa yet far enough away to avoid the main street traffic noise. The hotel has the best view of the sea and small islands and the Rendevouz Restaurant overlooks the sea and serves the most superb food at its restaurant. The breakfast is varied and generous and included in the tariff. The 12 rooms are private and run adjacent to the walkway and the marvellous gardens and fish ponds - such a tranquil oasis. There is a furness of hot water placed on the balcony table each day for tea and coffee and it's a great place to read and relax in the afternoon after swimming and touring. The rooms are brilliant and impeccably clean and light filled. There is an in room safe; well stocked mini bar; suitcase rack; huge comfortable king size bed with mosquito net drawn each evening; cupboard; dressing gown; quiet air conditioner and the bed is turned down each evening. The bathroom is open air but privacy is maintained with the bamboo blinds. There is shampoo, conditioner and liquid bath soap in beautiful ceramic containers and the aroma is superb. There is toothbrush & toothpaste. The bath towels, bath mats and linen are clean and white. The rooms are serviced daily and are maintained to a very high standard. The grounds are maintained to immaculate standards. Alam Asmara is consistent in maintaining a high standard of accommodation and service.

It is the staff who make Alam Asmara such a delight to visit. All the staff go above and beyond to ensure that your stay is enjoyable and if you have any requests these are all met with a smile and a desire to please. The staff are so welcoming from the greeting at reception to the restaurant staff, the housekeeping and everyone concerned with the management of the resort. This is a very professional operation and it never disappoints. Next time I stay in Candidasa I will email the resort direct so as not to be disappointed because I know that they will do everything possible to accommodate a request and I recommend that you contact Alam Asmara direct for your bookings if possible. I cannot speak more highly of this wonderful Boutique Hotel and highly recommend Alam Asmara to you.
title: Consistently Excellent! Amazing Alam Asmara!

text:
We stayed there 2 nights (end of July 2013, we wanted to stay near Padangbai because we had to take the fast-boat to Gilis) in room n.108 and we enjoyed it a lot! 
As others wrote, bedroom is small but well equipped and very clean, with mini-fridge, tv, AC, wardrobe, space for luggage, good-size safety box. Bathroom is very nice: open air but with bamboo blinds, with lovely-scented amenities. Sheets and towels (2 small and 2 large: this is unusual in Bali!) are very good quality. Bed and pillows are very comfortable: actually we had one of our best sleep in Indonesia also because there was no noise from dogs, cocks, traffic… There is a nice little veranda outside of the room with 2 chairs and a little table with tea/coffee facilities (they provide hot water in a thermos). The setting is very relaxing, with the fish pond surrounding the rooms and the nice view from restaurant/pool area.
Staff is very kind and speak a good English, except at restaurant where we had some difficulties in ordering our eggs (!?!).
We didn’t like breakfast: we had the “American” one (you have to choose from a menu the night before), but the bread was so-so, the pastry raw, the fruit juice with too much ice, scramble eggs with almost everything inside (we wanted them plain!).
There’s not much to do in Candidasa: the sea was very rough and unsuitable for swimming, we walked along the road on the right at hotel exit on main road and got first to a beautiful view point, then to the local village set amidst palms where one can have a nice walk always greeted by the lovely people!
title: We loved the room!

text: My friend and I spent incredible 11 days at Alam Asmara Dive Resort. We were amazed by the professionalism of the staff, their kind and welcoming attitude to the guests, wiling to help at any time and what is more - sincere smiles! We do recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to find ones own piece in unbelievably beautiful Bali! Our special thanks to Receptionists, ladies at the Restaurant and the fisherman and his cousin driver and brother! You are amazing!
title: The best place in Bali to have incredible time and just relax!

text: We stayed from July 12 to 16, 2013. This place has very nice bungalows with fish ponds. The room was rather small but big open air bath room. We have everything we need in the room, from slippers, bath robes, mini bar and lots of towels. Plenty of fresh water with the right pressure at the bathroom. We did 9 dives in 3 days arranged by Alam Asmara to Tulamben area at the Liberty wreck and Seraya and, Padang Bai area at Jepun and Blue Lagoon sites. The transport was nice and the dive master, Pak Made was very helpful and knows the area well. The food here was good and at affordable price. On Saturday late afternoon they provide us with free snacks and on Sunday night we had Balinese dancer performing. The garden and surrounding area are very nice and well maintained. I recommend this place for staying at Candi Dasa area.
title: "Nice place with beautiful view"

text:
This was our 4th trip to Bali and we decided to stay at the Alam Asmara for 8 days between 8 and 16th June after personal recommendation and Trip Advisor reviews . 

We loved the beautiful design of the entire hotel with the fish ponds. The rooms/bungalows are smallish but well laid out and have everything you need, Including a safe. The padlock on the room front door was a little awkward as a front door lock but a very minor issue. The beds were always beautifully made up (complete with towel animals). We had a room change after day 1 due to a broken toilet seat. Managed without fuss and bother by Made at reception. We loved the "garden" bathroom which was eminently practical.  Although there was no immediate beach access, the views from the restaurant and pool area are amazing and access to the lovely and nearby White Sand Beach was easily arranged for a modest charge for a driver. 

Breakfasts whilst not of the unlimited buffet variety  (realistically too much to expect from small boutique hotel at this price point) were always plentiful, well presented  and of high quality. In general all other food at the restaurant as also well presented and of high quality, although we had an issue with a lobster salad one evening, which while not so serious to us was taken seriously by the staff and  we were treated to a complimentary dinner. 

We used the spa on several occasions and the massages provided were very good and not overly expensive. The couple massages even managed to have what appears to be a unique selling point of synchronised massaging by both masseuses! 

I organised 1 dive trip with Yos diving via the hotel with Tika (hope I spelled this correctly) and had a great day at Tulamben (spoilt only by a minor muscle tear after a cramp - my fault entirely) which resulted in dive 2 having to be cancelled.  The hotel staff realising my wife has some minor mobility problems also paid her special attention whilst I was away  to check she had everything she needed and was not having any problems.

We thoroughly loved our stay at this hotel. It would be unfair to single out any of the staff as they were all praiseworthy and an asset to the establishment. We would stay here again without hesitation. Also worthy of note, was the tip box held at reception. When I asked if I could make a contribution for all the lovely service, I was told that they donate 20% of their tips to local charities.
title: Fantastic 8 day stay Alam Asmara

photos.caption: Lovely open air garden bathroom shower
Beautiful towelling animals on the bed every day - a nice touch

text: We came here after looking at it on the Internet....this place is fantastic...the staff are amazing and will do anything to help. Great personal touches like hot water thermos out the front, plug in mozzie unit, turn down service every night. When we arrived the manager went through everything with us in the room...we have travelled all around bali for the past 11 nights and this would have to be the best so far and the price is well worth the money....the fish ponds that run along and next to all the rooms and the scenery is so relaxing.....we decide to add an extra night onto our stay in Candidasa after about half an hour of being here....we would stay longer if we could, and if we come back to this area, we will definitely return here....thanks you to all the staff for making us feel so welcome....we hope to see you again :)
title: Beautiful resort

text: OMG!!!! This place is amazing. From the moment you walk into the reception area all the way through to the restaurant.... you are made to feel special, like your the only ones in the resort. We had such a relaxing stay, our only fault was of our own doing.... that we only organised a 2 night stay here. The fishpond entry into every bungalow... beautiful, the rooms/outdoor bathroom... perfect, the food... sensational, the service...the best!  All at an affordable rate. It's a must stay if you are up the east coast and need peace and quiet.
title: Ahhhh... Alam Asmara

text:
We spent one night in this beatiful hotel during our roundtrip across the island.
The atmosphere, the restaurant and the unbelievable friendly staff were great and we enjoyed the stay. 
The rooms have everything necessary and offer a lot of comfort.
title: Beautiful hotel for relaxing stay

text:
This is about our 5th stay at alam asmara at Candi Dasa and we will be back next year.
It is by far our favourite place to stay in Bali. The food at Rendevous restaurant is the freshest and best. Billy and the  boys that hang out the front will even take you to catch your own fish and the chef will cook it for you that day.
The scenery and the rooms are beautiful. 
The staff are the best in Bali. Nothing is a problem for them. When we arrive we feel like we have come home.
I recommend this hotel to all my friends, as nothing can compare to this hotel anywhere in Bali.
title: Best Service

text: My husband and I stayed 5 nights here and loved every minute of it!  From the moment we arrived the service was second to none.  Attention to detail was evident right down to the traditional dress style of the reception staff.  Although the rooms are not big they are most definately adequate with beautiful big 4 poster bed, wardrobe with safe, fridge and television.  The outdoor bathroom was also lovely.  Each bungalow has a lovely fish pond outside as well as a little verandah where you can sit and have an evening drink.  The gardens are delightful as is the lovely pool.  Although there is no beach as such, you can access the sea from some steps from the hotel where you can snorkel and swim.  The restaurant is lovely and all the food is preservative free and served fresh.  A very special thanks to Made who made our stay very special by ensuring we had everything we needed and was very helpful with advice for local attractions.  Pande in the restaurant was also lovely.  Although this is a small resort it is ideal for the 'romantic' and those that dont like hustle and bustle.  I would thoroughly recommend staying here and will most definitely be booking again myself.
title: Absolutely Beautiful

photos.caption: View from the restaurant and pool area
Entrance to our room with own fish pond
All rooms have lovely 4 poster bed

text: Three of us have just finished a five night stay here. We had two bungalows which were lovely with very comfy beds and mosquito netting which are drawn by the staff each evening, and a great outdoor bathroom with stone shower, all very private. There are only 12 bungalows in the resort, so a max of 24 people if full.  If you like small, serene, and personal then this is the place. The stone pool situated next to sea is lovely and very deep at one end. Rendezvous restaurant is the complexes eatery and its right next to the pool offering some of the best views to Nusa Penida in the east and south towards blue lagoon. I sat for hours watching the distant sea traffic, of ferries heading over to Lombok, an occasional cruise ship, and loads of other sea craft all going about their business. On low tide you can snorkel directly in front of the hotel. The staff were wonderful, professional but unobtrusive. Also the cost is great value for money at around A$80 a night. This is our 7th time in Bali and we are constantly on the lookout for smaller more traditional style accommodation in beautiful locations and Alam Asmara ticks all the boxes, and is now in our top five places and top of the list for Candi Dasa.
title: Wonderful little gem!

text: A perfect place to stay for scuba diving. The pool and terrace has a great view of Nusa Lembongan. The rooms are clean with a very nice king bed - the staff is well-organized and service oriented.  We plan to stay at the Alam Asmara again. FYI, Candidasa does not have sandy beaches - most of the area is protected by a seawall.
title: Small intimate hotel in Candidasa

text: This small hotel is delightful to stay at. The atmosphere is serene. The gardens and pool area are beautiful. The rooms are spotlessly clean. The food at the restaurant is delicious, well presented and well priced. Lastly but not least the staff are welcoming and friendly without being intrusive. Highly recommend this hotel.
title: My favourite hotel in Bali - wonderful

text: Lots of greenery and running water as decor for hotel grounds, very serene and quiet atmosphere.  The rooms are nicely decorated with an outside sitting area under the shades.  The bathroom is a very neat open air one.  Great view of the ocean from the restaurant.
title: Very nice boutique hotel

photos.caption: Nice little space beside each bungalow

text: We stayed for two weeks in March. It had been over a year since our last stay and the high standards were still evident and we were greeted like family. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well maintained and unlike others who have reviewed, we found there was sufficient room for our belongings and the bathroom is spacious, clean and has soap, shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush, a drying rack and towels are changed daily. The rooms are serviced daily and the beds turned down and mosquito nets drawn each evening. The room had an efficient air con. The hotel was sprayed for mosquitos while we were there which is done on a regular basis. The attention to detail is all there and if anything needs attention, the staff do their utmost to fulfill any reasonable request. The staff go out of their way, to make all guests feel that they are important and special. I had my birthday and the hotel organised a birthday cake. My sister had, without my knowledge, arranged for flowers and champagne directly with the hotel and she later told me that this had been a streamlined and easy process to arrange. The hotel ambience is enhanced by the beautiful gardens and fish ponds that run adjacent to the walkway between the rooms, not to mention the amazing outlook at the ocean front to the three small islands and then Nusa Penida. The restaurant serves delicious food with a varied menu. Breakfast is included and I like the cappucinos. The hotel spa has reasonable prices for massages, pedi, mani etc. The pool is clean and refreshing and when the tide is low, there are steps leading into the lagoon out front for a swim in the sea. Alam Asmara is in a great location, very quiet, peaceful with the sound of the sea lulling guests to sleep. It is also convenient to the main street in Candidasa where there are shops and other restaurants. We also had to organise for the doctor to come and this was all handled efficiently with concern for the wellbeing. We've written reviews previously about Alam Asmara and I'm pleased to report that the hotel is still a wonderful place to stay.
title: Wonderful Small Boutique Hotel

text: We made an unplanned stop  here last February on returning early from a less than fun stay in Amed and we were so glad we did. A small and simple but truly lovely hotel on the waterfront. Good value for money and very comfortable rooms. Yes they are small but tastefully furnished with some luxurious touches and very clean. A perfect place for couples. The staff were excellent and the restaurant was very good as well. We would come back again in a heartbeat and we will on our next visit. Thankyou to the wonderful staff and the great chef.
title: great little hotel

text:
We stayed at Alam Asmara as a couple for 5 days to explore East Bali. The small hotel complex (12 bungalows all of equal size) is very pretty, scenic and relaxing and the staff were truly excellent, professional, efficient and friendly (especially the lovely Mudita).

All of the small bungalows are set back off a beautifully kept water walkway with fish swimming and trees overhanging, creating privacy between the accommodation. Unlike other comments here we found the accommodation perfectly large enough with good a/c, fully provisioned and clean garden bathrooms and a small terrace at the front.

At the rear of the complex is an infinity pool, and the 'Rendezvous' restaurant overlooks the sea (great sunset viewing). The food is good but there are lots of other options nearby also.

We cant comment on the diving as we chose this hotel as a base to explore from and the hotel staff organised car&driver and itinerary with ease.

A great relaxed and romantic setting with impeccable service, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
title: Perfect base for exploring East Bali

photos.caption: pool & sea view at Alam Asmara

text: We spent 5 days here. All the staff were friendly and welcoming. The hotel is in a peaceful location overlooking the sea. We enjoyed the style of the rooms and everything was very clean and well maintained. We ate all our dinners there because the food was good and the setting was perfect for us. No beach but there were boats or cars to take us to a lovely sandy cove close by and the swimming pool was good to have a quick dip. We went snorkelling and fishing. The hotel arranged a car for us to visit a traditional village and some temples . We would like to go back...
title: Place of calm

text: The small bungalow style rooms with kingsized bed and outdoor stone bathroom were wonderful for a traditional feel of Bali. The walkways surrounded buy lush tropical plants and Koi fishponds were stunning. The pool was clean and refreshing and hubby loved being able to dive straight into the ocean in the mornings. The whole resort was imaculately clean and fresh. The restaurant food was sensational and we loved the food so much we ate nearly every meal there. Hubby LOVED the sate beef! As it was our 20th anniversary we were treated like a honeymoon couple with a petal heart welcoming doormat and a delicious heart shapped anniversary cake. The greatest asset to this resort is the staff. They were the best we found in the whole of Bali. Super friendly, very efficient at their jobs, and they were attentive to every wish you had and then all the ones you hadn't thought of yet. We were totally pampered! Snorkelling, fishing and trekking are the main adventure activities in Candidasa, so unless you are happy to lounge around the pool or go sightseeing 3 or 4 days is probably enough time in Candidasa for a young couple. Absolutely LOVED Alam Asmara and would definitely stay there again!
title: Perfect romantic destination

photos.caption: Anniversary cake made by the chef.

text: It has good location, close to everything and has affordable price level. Here is cheap minibar, laundry service. Room was small, dark, with bad noise insulation, but bed was really kingsize and very very comfortable. I dont like outside bathroom without sidewall, it is not for me. Territory is also too small, bungalows is very closed to each other. There is no beach, only small swimming pool with 4 or 5 sun-beds. Staff is very friendly, like everywhere in Bali. They have own dive center with excellent dive master Tika. This man is great profi! I'm thankful for my unforgettable diving with him. So, if you search hotel for beach rest you need something other, if you come for find great entertainment outside, and you need hotel for sleeping and for storage your bags Alam Asmara is the best choice in Candidasa.
title: Three stars hotel in european classification

text:
beautiful hotel, clean rooms, soft (comfy!) king bed, outdoor bathroom with huge stone bathtub, delicious food, best scrambled eggs in Bali...and the staff is excellent! they organized a dive trip for us, took care of transportation, everything. so friendly and kind. 
it's right on the water but no beach. not a problem, since there is an amazing white sand beach a ten minute drive away...
we loved it here.
title: five stars!

owner_response.text:
Dear Value Guest..

Thank you for your complimentary comment and glad to hear that you were happy with our service and small boutique resort and with my team love to welcoming you comeback again in future.

We will keep and do more for our more feel touch service, once your comment is our great support to do again some more different.

Nice regards,

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The Alam Asmara Dive Resort is situated on a stunning piece of coast line with beautifully laid out rooms. The semi enclosed bathroom gives the traveller plenty of room to unwind and enjoy garden scenery that is lush and tropical. The hotel restaurant served tasty yet timely food with a variety of choices. The resort staff were always extremely helpful, respectful and organised absolutely anything we wanted with a welcoming smile. The scuba diving packages offered through the hotel were competitive with local individual tour operators and did not disappoint well experienced divers. Should you want to go diving in some of Bali's best sites and be welcomed home with a cold drink and a smile, then stay at Alam Asmara Resort :-)
title: Absolutely perfect

owner_response.text:
Dear Value Guest...

Warmest greeting from our team at Alam Asmara Dive Resort & Spa...

Thank you for your absolute and complimentary comment, our team was so happy to hear from you and you were happy and enjoy to stay with us...

Once again thank you and waiting your return again.

Nice regards,


Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Three couples stayed at the Alam Asmara and we loved the resort. The rooms are modern and very clean with the bathroom partly open air. The resort is set on a narrow block with a lovely pool that has some shade and some sun. Sunbeds look across the water where you can go fishing or snorkelling. The breakfast was fresh and the staff friendly. There are many restaurants close to the resort and the Rendevous Restaurant at the resort has a very good reputation, particularly for seafood. The main street is just outside the resort a very short walk where you will find a Family Mart where you can buy water etc. Vincent's Restaurant is a favourite and we ate there more than once. When you walk out of the resort the little restaurant on the left side corner had excellent Indonesian food. Candidasa is small and quiet but has enough to see and enjoy such as a trip up to Ahmed which has stunning views across the beautiful blue waters.
We have recommended Alam Asmara to our friends who will be staying there in May-June 2013.
title: Delightful Small Resort overlooking the water

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest.

Warmest greeting from east of Bali...with small boutique resort at Alam Asmara Dive Resort.

As management and team want to thank you for your stay and you were enjoy and happy to stay in our resort.

Nice regards.

Wayan kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I would highly recommend Alam Asmara after staying there on the last three days of our 2 week holiday celebrating my daughter's birthday.  We had not been to Candidasa previously and were certainly not disappointed with it's location,  it offers a different experience to the more populated areas.  It was a perfect ending to our time in Bali.  The staff are wonderful,  friendly and attentive.   The resort is situated on the ocean front and dining in the restaurant, lounging by the pool listening to the waves crashing on the shore was wonderfully relaxing.  We would highly recommend the spa for extra pampering, excellent massage!   The rooms were well decorated, immaculate and comfortable.   The restaurant prepared a delicious fish meal for us caught by a family member off shore.       We will hopefully return to Alam Asmara in the not too distant future.    Kathryn
title: Most enjoyable stay in Candidasa

text:
Bryan and I had an amazing experience at Candidasa and made all the more wonderful by choosing to stay at Alam Asmara. The staff could not have been more helpful. We happened accross this place on Tripadvisor and took a chance and booked. The best decision we could have made and confirmed from the moment of our arrival late at night. We entered a magical place after a long drive from the airport, an experience I will never forget (in a good way). It was our anniversary, they had our room decorated with frangipani and soft lighting, they brought us an exotic cocktail and we sat and listened to the quiet sound of the gentle waves on our doorstep. I have been to Bali a few times and this was up there as most memorable. We would return in a flash.
Kerri & Bryan
title: AMAZING LITTLE PIECE OF PARIDISE

owner_response.text:
Dear Value Guest..

Thank you for your great comment is best feedback for future of us and also our team been success to give you better service.

All our team to say a Mery Christmas and Happy New Year 2013.

We miss your return and stay with us again in future.

Nice regards,
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My boyfriend and I are here at the moment at the end of a short stay in Bali. I chose this hotel off Trip Advisor and I cannot recommend it enough. 

The staff are wonderful and friendly, very concerned with making your stay a good one. They were great at helping us organise tours etc.

The rooms are small but clean and beautifully decorated and the outside bathroom is nice. The only possible thing to complain about is that they tidied the rooms too much! 

The restaurant is nice, the food is good and it is right on the sea. Boyfriend assures me that the pool is clean and nice to swim in. Spa is neat and clean and pretty good value.

For a couples holiday in Bali this place is perfect. I loved being able to hear the sea from my room. Thank you Agus, Made and the other staff for looking after us!
title: Great service, great staff, great location

owner_response.text:
Dear Value Guest,

A Mery Christmas and Happy New Year 2013.

Thank you for your complimentary comment and all my team so happy to hear this and your pleasure stay with us is our future and keep our motto forget tomorrow, meaning is keep your traffics and enjoy your sleep, and holiday with us.

We miss your return again

Best regards.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Alam Asmara is a lovely resort on the ocean. The location is beautiful and the staff are lovely. We didn't need any thing, but am sure if we did, it would not have been a problem. Their restaurant has to be one of the highlights of Candidasa, with beautiful breakfasts and an even better menu for lunch & dinner.
title: Beautiful Candidasa

owner_response.text:
Dear Jo A..

On behalf of our team in the Alam Asmara Dive Resort and Rendezvous Restaurant would like to thank you have to stay and enjoy a vacation with us.

with great pleasure we would like you to come back and stay with us in the future.

We have submitted this review to our team.

Be remember our motto is forget tomorrow ..

Nice regards,,

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We had a good time staying at Alam Asmara in 2011. It's a small resort, small rooms but very  very clean with unforgettable ambient of Bali lifestyle. Great staffs with excellent hospitality. Took good cares of everything even a tiny picky issue. Favorite for couples without children. WE also experienced the best dive experience with YOS Dive Bali. We were so close to Mola Mola in the first dive already. It was amazing! Thank you YOS!
title: Got whatever you need satisfied at Bali.

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your compliment and great feed back, you were enjoy to stay and diving with us.

We hope to welcoming you back again in future and we do our best to served you again.

Nice regards,

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Alam asmara is a small resort with only 12 bungalows. It is quite suitable for honemooners but a little bit boring for family with small children. The staffs always try to give us their best service which we quite appreciate. 

The only pity is that the hotel does not provide free shuttle to near attraction of Candidasa like to the candidasa shops, pasir putih (the beach that allows you to swim), etc. The hotel charged transportation fee per persons for transporting everyone to nearby attraction. 
As we were travelling with two 5-7 years old children, a hotel with a direct access to the beach might have been a better choice. This hotel has sea view but it does not have direct access for guests to swim in the sea.
The hotel car seemed to be free at most times, they should make good use of it like free shuttle for the hotel guests.
title: A nice resort for honeymooners but not for family with children.

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

We are so happy to get your feed back and Thank you we glad to welcoming you  comeback again in future stay with us for your wedding anniversary, and we will prepared your great honeymoon concept.

Thank you and nice regards,

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Perfect service. Brilliant restaurant overlooking the sea. No sand beach at all - so be aware. Candidasa is about 3 hours by taxi (about $30) from Denpasar (pre-book a Blue Bird taxi - the lines are very long at the airport arrivals).
The rooms themselves are small traditional villas, albeit with a TV and A/C, and a completely outdoor bathroom. Don't worry about privacy in the bathroom - the walls are high, and most of it is covered with a roof too.
The king size beds are amazing, and have a four-poster feel with mosquito net.
Probably not a good choice for families, since there are erotic stone carvings in walls throughout the site - a rather unusual feature for a "Dive Resort" - but perfect for couples.
I can't recommend this place enough.
title: Perfect honeymoon

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest.

Thank you for your complimentary and you was enjoy your honeymoon with us.

we hope you will comeback in future with your wedding anniversary in our romantic resort and spa.

Please keep this memorial in you feel and love.

Nice regards.

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I returned to Alam Asmara on 21 March,as a solo traveller (my husband and I married here on 29 December 2011) on the eve of Nyepi Day. I had a pick up from the airport and I had an interesting drive to Candidasa. All the villages had made Ogeh-Ogeh's. On my arrival the Manager, Wayan, organised for guests to go to the nearby village to watch the Ogeh-Ogeh parade and I am so glad I went. The Ogeh-Ogeh are paper mache monsters who are burnt afterwards. Nyepi Day was a day of silence throughout the whole of Bali celebrated annually by the Balinese. The hotel still provided meals and guests stayed within the hotel, relaxing by the pool.

I stayed for 12 days on my own but I was never lonely or bored. The staff were so attentive and friendly. I did the cooking class one day which was fantastic - no stress - Nyoman, the Chef, was so patient and helpful. I received photos, apron, recipes and learnt some new skills. The class was well organised by the front office and kitchen. I can recommend the class.

I barely spent any time in my room except to sleep at night and shower. The rooms are exceptionally clean and well maintained. I like the in room safe. The king sized bed and ambience of the room is wonderful with little details like the frangipani (jepun) on the bed, hisbiscus flower in the bathroom. The bathroom is open air but private and undercover with plenty of room and a rack to hang clothes. There is a good TV and mini bar. Every afternoon a hot water thermos is placed on the balcony table for tea and coffee. The balcony is private and comfortable. Breakfast is included in the price and there is a wide choice of food.

The Rendevouzs Restaurant serves superb, fresh Balinese and western dishes. On a few nights a week, young Balinese girls perform traditional Balinese dances. This restaurant possibly has one of the best views in Candidasa as it is situated right on the water overlooking (3) small islands, Nusa Penida, the local fishing boats (jukung) and the blue sea. The restaurant staff are so willing to help. I loved having a large capaccino every afternoon which is served with biscuits. Every dish, was beautifully presented and I never tired of the food, all at a reasonable price.

The front office staff and reception do a tremendous job. Nothing is too much trouble, from organising trips, diving, internet, advice about sim card for mobile phone, laundry, a friendly chat and greeting - anything. I also had some pampering at the spa where you can have a nice massage, facial, manicure, pedicure, flower bath. The girls in the spa are fun and friendly.

I was so lucky because the weather was fantastic. I thought it may have rained more being the wet season but I was prepared with books which I never read because I went snorkelling to various nearby spots nearly every day. The young fishermen will see you at breakfast and they will ask you if you want to go out in their boat. Don't be afraid to go because you won't regret it. As is common, you have to barter to reach a fair price for you and the fisherman. Also, even though there is no beachfront at the hotel, you merely have to walk down some steps in front of the restaurant at low tide to have a refreshing swim in the sea. Of course there is also the pool, equally refreshing with clean water.

There are plenty of restaurants and shops outside the hotel where you can purchase extra water, soft drinks, etc. There are 2 ATMs nearby, money changers and a Hardy's in nearby Amlapura. You can buy sunglasses, hats from the street vendors. There are plenty of drivers to be found on the street who offer transport.

My husband and I can't wait to return to Alam Asmara in October for 2 weeks of tranquility and relaxation, away from the stress, and we are never bored with this. This is a small and friendly hotel with good food, accommodation and staff. The Manager, Mr Wayan Kariasa, pays great attention to detail. He is more than willing to ensure that his guests receive very good service at a reasonable price. The staff are exceptional. Thank you all so much!
title: RETURN VISIT TO ALAM ASMARA

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest...

Nice regards

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: This property is really pretty – with wooden walkways over a fish pond (we enjoyed feeding the fish each morning) and beach frontage.  There are lots of staff, constantly moving around working and stopping to say Hi.  Staff assisted us in arranging a snorkling trip to Blue Lagoon (highly recommended) and transport to Kuta.  The person maintaining our room needed a medal – we think they had OCD (joking!) as they must have cleaned our room about 5 times a day!  The rooms are small, but really pretty, but our room had a slight musty smell – guessing this may be a side effect of the thatched roof, as the room was clean.  They have a phone in the room to call reception (the only property we stayed in that had this), so it was very easy to get service if you needed it.  Laundry was more expensive than other properties, we just took our laundry to a service in the town.  The restaurant on site is great – once again, we needed to order breakfast the night before – this now seems pretty standard in Bali accommodation.  Was unfortunate that we had to pay for each meal at the restaurant at the time – we would have preferred to ‘run a tab’ and pay in one go at the end.   We enjoyed staying here and would definitely stay again.
title: Really pretty!

owner_response.text:

Nice regards,

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
My wife and I chose this hotel/ dive resort based on the location to be closer to the dive location we wanted to visit and got the most relaxing holiday in paradise you could wish for. We arranged with the resort to be picked up from the airport  and the first class experience begain, we were meet by there driver Norm with cold drinks and ice cold towels to cool down safely driven to the resort where we were greated by the friendly staff. 
We were shown via a raised walk way above fish ponds with lush tropical flowering plants over hanging to our beautiful bungaloo which was spotlessly clean, quiet well working air con, bar fridge, LCD tv with international channels and a king sized bed that made it very easy to sleep.
The restaurant has stunning views overlooking the ocean with chiefs that could be working in any top class resturants around the world. The meals they prepared are to die for my favourites is the Pan seared Mahi Mahi and the banana fritters very well priced.
We went diving with their Dive Master Tika to the Blue lagoon and Tulamben. The dive gear is good quality with clean air.  Tika was very professional made my wife feel very safe and made sure we got what we wanted to achieve out of each dive.
The fish life at both sites are excellent, 28degree C water temp good visibility. My favourite dive would be Tulamben which I dive 20yrs before to see the coral growth and ships decay is amazing. My wife conned me into a couples massage which I have to admit was relaxing and helped with the tight muscels from diving, the ladies were very skilled the second massage after the next dive was my idea very much worth the small cost. The resort is top class and I cannot wait to  see all the friendly staff again on our next trip back to this piece of paradise, only difference we will be makingthe visit longer.
title: Dream Holiday in Paradise

owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest.

Thank you for your great  review to our resort, our dream is your return again.

Best regards,

Wayan Kariasa
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We planed a trip to Bali and my husband wanted to also get his PADI scuba dive certified during our stay there. I came across this resort online and decided to stay with them after several efficient email back and forth with Agus. Agus and the team are very good in providing me the information I need on the dive programe.

Airport pick-up - Upon arrival at the airport, the pick-up sign was the first one we spoted. The driver was very attentative. He gave us ice cold water and ice cold towel to fresh up as soon as we got in the car.

Service & Room - Arrived at the resort, "Made" came up to greet us and help us check in in no time. He showed us the room in great detail. The room isn't very big, but big enough to unpack and settle in. The room is very clean and comfortable, especially the bed. We like the outdoor bathroom with the huge stone tub. We find it very convenient to wash our dive gears and hang there to dry. There's a safe in the room, which is convenient to lock valueable things up. we love the sitting area on the front porch, admiring the fish in the pond and the green vegetation. I love sitting out there in the early morning and late afternoon enjoy my coffee. there are only 12 bungalows, each is surrounded with fish pond and vegetation. it's very secluded and quiet. 

Resort restaurant - on the water. we had our candel light dinner the 1st night, it came with the package we purchased. they set up a signal table with candles around on that platform by the pool and over look ocean. the food was great. how more romantic could it be. based on the other reviews complaining food outside of the resort is cheaper, we therefore tried outside. Our conclusion is eat at the resort, not worth trying out there. it may be IDR11,000 (rupiah) more for the main course at the resort, but really, it's only less than USD2 more. And you get a bigger portion, better presentation and quality than the restaurants outside. We had the best grill snapper and mahi mahi at the resort restaurant. Breakfast is served there too and you get to pick from 4 choices. the only thing I find they could improve a bit is, not to charge for 2 slices of white bread at breakfast. My husband order oatmeal for breakfast 2 monring and need extra 2 slices of bread to fill him up before we went out diving. I was a bit surprised they want to charge us this. it's cheap, only USD1.50. But it's not so cheap for only 2 slices of bread. they can do better on this to make the guest feel even greater.

Massage - We had the massage at the resort. it was fine. And my massage girl, Susi, went out of her way and took me out on her scooter and shop for batik & saroon. I really appreciate that.

Dive - other reviews about dive with this resort were not too positive and we were abit reserved. And boy we were wrong. The service we received was unbelievably great. We didn't sign up one on one course for my husband since it's cheaper. but it turned out a personal course. The dive instructor, Made, came to the hotel from their dive head office (2 hrs away) and spent the whole day with my husband teaching him in the class and then close-water class at the resort pool. There were no one in the pool that day. I've not dived for 7 years and he offer me to practice in the pool when they were done w/ the lessons. He took us out on the traditional boat to Blue Lagoon. The next day we went to northeast of Bali island to dive at Liberty ship wreck, 2 hrs drive. it was the experience of life-time. Made is a young dive instructor/master, strict with the skills we need to obtain. with one of the shore dive, I need to carry my gears walking into the water. with me weight only 46kg (103 lbs) he help to carry my gears and hold on to me to ensure I wouldn't fall. He constantly check with us under the water ensure we are fine. I asked him about the bad review, it was the previous guy who didn't care much. If you do consider going to Bali diving and like to stay at nice resort but not over-priced, I highly recommend this resort to stay. it locates in between two good dive sites.

Resort location - 3 mins walk out on the main street, there are plenty restaurants, shops for anything you need. it's not a busy area like Ubud. If you want to place to hide away, enjoy the quietness and still have good quality of stay, this is the one.

Mind you, no sandy beach - almost all resort in that area have no sandy beach. it's just the way it is. we don't mind this at all. we can still sit at pool lounge chair and watch the waves. you can get down stairs for a good swim when the tie is low.

We love it here so much and already talking about keep coming back and stay with them in the soon future. We spent the last 2 nights in Ubud at Royal Pita Maha, which cost 5 times higher than the room in Alam Asmara. Yes the villa was nice and big, amenities are at their grand, but we kept talking about Alam Asmara. it was the people who touch our heart and made us enjoy our stay there so much.
title: left our heart there
